Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Clean & great location for Disney”
Reviews.Author: nedoth
Reviews.Content: My 2 boys (8 & 10) and my wife and I stayed here for a week to do all the Disney parks. Ideal location situated on a straight road in to the main Disney area about 5 minutes away. Very clean room and most importantly comfy beds. Fairly substantial self serve breakfast, ideal for those long days. Laundry facilities on 2 floors for a fee of $1.50. We found little noise through the night and were at the front of the Hotel facing the main highway. Slept really well all week. 2 HD flat screen TVs ideal for weather & travel updates. Only downside was no free Wi-Fi as have to pay although Starbucks just up the road so park up and use theirs with a coffee.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: srr91899
Reviews.Content: We love Buena Vista suites always happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your buck!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaNL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 2011 for a week. 4 adults and a 3 year old. Very very pleased with the stay. What's great about this place is: -free shuttles to Disney -free buffet (huge savings for 5 of us to eat a free meal a day). The food was good basic but good and hard to complain when it's free. -room has a bedroom seperate from the living area with 2 beds. Fridge & microwave. -the pool is quiet and very relaxing. Thr area is gated so the kids are safe. There is also a hot tub for the adults. The waitress from the inside restaurant also serves while you are pool side, very nice. Overall this is a great place to stay while visiting Disney World, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Buena Vista Suites”
Reviews.Author: LindaK705
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Buena Vista Suites for every trip to Disney or the Orlando area. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The rooms are spacious with a separate living room/TV area and bedroom with double queens. Complimentary bus service to the parks is available. The breakfast buffet is tasty and varied from day to day. Made to order breakfast is also available and included with the price of your room. The hotel is very clean and the breakfast/dining area staff keeps that room exceptionally clean. The breakfast room is very large so you never feel crowded. We enjoyed the outdoor pool and hot tub. It is a straight drive into the Magic Kingdom of 2 miles from the hotel. Easy drive in and out to the various parks at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased”
Reviews.Author: Donna S
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at Buena Vista Suites. We had never stayed off Disney property before when visiting Disney World and were skeptical. The hotel was very convenient to the parks, breakfast was good, rooms were clean and modern although not very spacious. Parking was a pleasant surprise. We never parked more than 50 feet from an entrance even though the hotel was full. We asked for extra towels and were always left plenty by housekeeping. For the price I don't see how you could beat Buena Vista. Check-in took less than 2 minutes. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Food, Bad Service, Bait-and-Switch Theme Park Ticket Prices”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a bit outdated, rooms spacious and cleaniness is adequate; bad comfortable, don't go to this hotel if you expect tranquility. Frankly, I was o.k. with the room experience but the "included" free breakfast was horrible. We have a line that ran from outside the restaurant into the hall only to get to the buffet common area to find sub-par food; I like bacon or saugage with my meal; they have sub-par ham slices with pineapples in broth; the minature donuts were stale (it reminded of day-old bread store off-brand products). I get to the egg station only to find they don't make omelets; yet another strike here. The cereals are tolerable and the milk o.k.; the juice (mind you I'm in Florida, land of Oranges) and the orange juice was worse than Tang and about the same consistency. It gets better, I spoke to the conceirge desk over the phone a week or so before the trip to ask them about Disney theme park tickets and to compare. I asked specifically about the rates for (2) 4-day park hopper tickets. The rates they quoted me was $520 (tax included) for two tickets (no strings or stipulations). I re-affirmed this with the man on the phone and said I would purchase them once I arrived; he said that would be fine. The morning of my first full day I went down to the conceirge desk and was told the rates would be over $690 bucks. He proceeded to tell me that the rate was probably a rate qouted by the "other person" at the same conceirge desk, stating that he works for a different company. Clearly this tactic is a bait-and-switch tactic to get you hooked into sitting through their timeshare pitch. It is my opinion that this is fraudualent misrepresentation when one purports to be the conceirge desk only to bait and switch you on the terms given over the phone. So beware, this hotel, their service, and their business practices are not representative of a good hotel or vacation experience and don't get suckered. Buy your tickets somewhere else or at the theme park.

Reviews.Title: “Disney stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenkehoe
Reviews.Content: After spending much time selecting a place for my family to stay while on vacation, we chose the Buena Vista Suites. I must say that WE were VERY impressed. The hotel staff was very courteous, the rooms were extremely clean and MODERN!!!! The room was very spacious and well appointed. The pool was heated and the hot tub was clean. The hotel offers free breakfast to all, it is very basic but remember its free! The parking lot was secure and a conveneient location. I WOULD CERTAINLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: lisa m
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable and conveinant stay at the Buena Vista Suites. Loved the seperate living room area, fridge and plenty of drawer space. The conveinant buffet breakfast was good, however it could have been better. Will stay again, great location, very clean, employees were nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Transplant_Texan
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here coming to a seminar. The hallway had some chipped paint on the door, but the room was very nice. The sink had a granite table top and the bed linens were beautiful. With two queen-sized beds and a pull-out sofa bed, the is room for 6. The flat screen TVs in each room were big. The room had a microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. Free American breakfast buffet is included. Although not outstanding, it had scrambled eggs, potatoes, pancakes, oatmeal and cream of wheat. Made to order eggs (over easy or sunny side up) are available as well as fresh fruit and yogurt. It certainly provides a great benefit for a family. The only complaint I had was being charged for a local call when I asked to be connected to the sister property next door. Since the two hotels share a spa and restaurants, I thought it was strange they charged for an internal call.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay very close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: ankerstjerne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Spacious and clean rooms, very good breakfast and nice staff. Would stay here again, when we return to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but overpriced and didn't really work for us”
Reviews.Author: MArrington
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter, her best friend and I stayed at Buena Vista Suites for a family vacation. The good: The location of the hotel was perfect. We could get to the Disney Parks in a matter of minutes and other conveniences (restaurants, shopping, 7-11, etc) were right at our fingertips. The staff seemed friendly and the buffet was good. The not-so-good: The room was fairly nice, but it really did not accommodate us well. We were expecting the bedroom and the living room areas to be much larger than they were. They were rather tight. My husband and I had a king bed and the girls slept on the sofa bed in the living room. The bathroom and sink separated the living room and the bedroom, with the sink being in between the two rooms. The layout was a bit odd. The door to close off the bedroom was on the side of the sink area closest to the living room. It didn't make much sense to have the door in that spot, in my opinion. That said, if my husband and I wanted privacy, the girls would not have been able to use the sink or have access the shower/tub/toilet. My husband had to get showered and dressed before the girls woke up and he had to actually leave the hotel room so they could get ready. It was quite inconvenient for him. Access to the internet was imperative for us as I was taking online courses and my husband was teaching online during the vacation. Unfortunately, internet access was expensive at Buena Vista Suites. Considering they charge a resort fee, one would think wi-fi would be included in that charge. Not so, unfortunately. Everyday, we drove to a nearby McDonalds to work on our laptops. Another inconvenience. When the four of us returned to Orlando a few months later for vacation, we stayed at Floridays Resort. It was significantly better! My husband and I had our own bedroom and bathroom, and the girls had their own bedroom and bathroom. Also, the girls each had a full-size bed. It made them quite happy that they didn't have to sleep in the same bed as they did before. Additionally, we had a living room, dining area, full kitchen and washer/dryer. It was quite spacious and we didn't feel as though we were on top of each other. It was truly a home away from home. They did charge a resort fee, which was the same as Buena Vista, but it included wi-fi access. We also paid several hundred dollars less than we did at Buena Vista Suites, but we got so much more for our money. We stayed at both places from Thursday to Tuesday, so one cannot say that the difference in the price was because of the days of the week. If you do not need a lot of space or access to wireless internet, and you want to be close to Disney, Buena Vista Suites may be a good choice. However, if space, wi-fi access, great amenities, and an affordable price are what you're looking for, check out Floridays! It's approximately 6-7 minutes away from Buena Vista Suites and worth the extra minutes. In fact, it is just minutes away from Sea World too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Orlando near Disney world!!”
Reviews.Author: Prabhatkatyal
Reviews.Content: Buena Vista Suites is located about 17 miles from Orlando MCO airport and is a very good place to stay in Orlando for both Business and family travellers. This property is fairly close to Hotel Caribe Royal and is good place for conducting conferences as well. The rooms are really nice and the hotel service staff is really helpful. Food served is also good as they offer multiple cuisines. The hotel also runs a complimentary shuttle to Disney land and other tourist places in Orlando and it is really a good facility. There are also couple of eating joints about a mile away from this place if someone wants to eat food outside. Overall a fantastic place to stay in Orlando!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanjoseoooo
Reviews.Content: Our family booked two rooms for two nights. The hotel really exceeded our expectations. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The one bedroom suite gave us additional room especially if you are staying with children. The rooms were big and comfortable with small fridge and microwave. The beds were also very comfortable. We also enjoyed a buffet breakfast with made to order eggs. Our grandchildren enjoyed swimming in the heated pool because it was a little chilly in the evenings in February even in Florida. The hotel is also an easy short drive to the Disney theme parks. We will absolutely stay at the Buena Vista Suites again. Great hotel with reasonable rates!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BongoB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week while at the ATIA conference. For the price it ras a great place. The price includes a full buffet breakfast. The rooms are decorated well wit 2 HD flat screen televisions. Rms are clean, the beds are so cozy. The only negative is the access to the Internet is $8.99 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: hotelek
Reviews.Content: Great Place, Location and Price. Just needs a to improve the breakfast buffet. Service overall was wonderful, congratulations to front desk, housekeeping and restaurant personnel

Reviews.Title: “Liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elliotu
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very good rooms. Its very clean. The only problem is that if you are going there to visit the Disney or Universal theme parks, you need to rent a car because they have very limited bus service to the parks. My purpose was not to visit the parks so I was fine with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Suites Near Disney world”
Reviews.Author: Appocollalter
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay here.. Pros: The suites were nice.. Each suites had separate bedroom. Both the living room and the bed room had separate TV.. The Living room had microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker and a office desk.. The Deluxe King suite had a Jetted Tub... The suite was clean and the hotel was located close to Disney. Complementary Breakfast was good. Help desk with travel agents. Cons: A/C was not cool enough. The internet was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Fans of Buena Vista Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Taminator102
Reviews.Content: Totally enjoyable stay here. We had $100 worth of food & drink vouchers that they honored, no problem. Staff was friendly and helpful, suites on 7th floor where we stayed were wonderful, breakfast was very good, location is near all attractions, stores, and restaurants you could ask for. Only two negatives (reason for 4 stars): first thing you see upon entering the suite is water bottles labeled $2.95 each that will be added to your bill if you drink them...huh? Minor but so tacky...either offer waters free or don't offer them at all. Also, Vista Bistro Restaurant seems to be understaffed with slow service but has great food. This is now the only place we would stay when visiting Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised to find problems in such a competitive market.”
Reviews.Author: DonCapeMayBeach
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel near the Marriott. The Buena Vista Suites seemed to be perfect and also seem to be somehow connected to the Carribe Royale next door. All good news I thought. Orlando is a town full of hotel competition keeping prices down. I have stayed in nearby motels for only $35/night that included an adequate breakfast. The rooms were clean and functional. I thought it would be good to try something else at about $100/night. I was told it is an all suites hotel. When I arrived one person at the reception was helping a guest. The other was talking to another employee. Finally that employee walked away but the other person still didn't acknowledge me. I stood there for 5 minutes before she finally looked up. I figured that is a bad beginning. The hotel room looked fine when I opened the door, but there was a stale air odor. Unfortunately there is only one window that cannot be opened, so any air change would be from the HVAC or by leaving the hall door open. The room was functional, but the furniture was tattered and chipped. I found some mold in the bathroom. Although there was a cleverly folded swan towel on the bed and the tissues and toilet paper had nice folds, the bathroom smelled like urine. It was almost sickening to go in there. It made me wonder how clean the rest of it is. I also wondered why do all the folding and not bother cleaning well? I decided to eat in the restaurant one night. They were very nice and accommodating. The food was also quite delicious, which I find to be somewhat uncommon in Orlando and was totally unexpected in this hotel. That was a huge surprise. Another person I spoke with at the reception area was also charming, so it seems that first day was an anomaly. By the way, they do offer internet connection for a fee â€“ I believe it was under $10/day. The smell of the room changed this morning. Around 5am there was a very strong garlic odor â€“ as if standing right over the skillet browning garlic - oddly stronger in the room from the HVAC than in the hall. It was annoying enough I had to get ready to leave sooner than planned to get away from it. I guess $100 isn't bad for a tattered smelly room in some markets (NYC), but here with all the competition, I was very surprised. Over the days I was there I noticed there are many tour groups here but also families and foreign visitors. The breakfast isn't very good, but is adequate. It isn't much better than the $35 nearby motel. I normally tip for included breakfasts, but here they had dollar bills hanging around as it if were a strip joint. They would make you egg, but expected a tip. Same with clearing the table. It seemed a bit in your face. I would recommend this, but with hesitation. I would also tell others in the 30 years I have been coming here each year, I have found many other better values nearby. Better rooms and meals for way under $100.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: WITransplants
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Buena Vista Suites for five nights. Room worked out fine - two TV's for the two of us. As others have said, breakfast wasn't the best but was convenient. Upon arrival, we had a complimentary drink in the bar (booked room through Mousesavers). Only negative was we thought the room needed painting but otherwise was clean. Good location as far as Disney goes but not many dining places you could walk to. We had a car so didn't use their transportation. All in all, good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: cory r
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week for a nearby conference. Very good hotel. Excellent suite/room, seemed almost new -- from the bedding to the flat screen TV's. The room had a flat screen in living room area and another one in the bedroom. The living room area was a good size, with a couch/loveseat-type chair, a desk and a very nice entertainment unit. The unit housed a refrigerator, microwave, draws, etc. They had a coffee machine as well. The bedroom area was nice too. Plenty of draws and closet space. Very good location, near most major roads/highways. The hotel also offered a complimentary buffet breakfast every morning -- creal, eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles/french toast/pancakes, and made-to-order omelettes, as well as juice and coffee -- and it was good. Basic breakfast but nice way to start the day. Maid service was excellent as well. Free parking, taxis waiting outside, nearby restaurants. I enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “"Would recommend!"”
Reviews.Author: Christina A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec. 19-Dec. 26 on a family vacation. My husband, myself and our three children were on Christmas vacation and we stayed in a Queen Suite on the third floor. The living room had the full size sofa sleeper and the bedroom had two queen beds. The beds were very comfortable as was the sofa sleeper. The only problem we had was that the air blowing into the living room was accurate with the thermostat setting but the air coming into the bedroom felt much colder. We never complained - just used the comforters in the bedroom and everything was fine. The hotel is very clean and our room was cleaned well. The room itself is a bit dated but for the price, we can't complain. I agree with a previous reviewer that towel bars are needed at the sink area. We just hung our hand towel on the swing out arm of the magnifying mirror. The TV's were nice but sometimes the channels were a bit slow to respond to the remote. Breakfast was great. Scrambled eggs, sausage links or ham and one day there was bacon. Made to order over-easy or sunny side eggs was a nice bonus. There was oatmeal, grits, hash browns, cereal, yogurt, canned fruit, and fresh orange slices every day. The hot food stayed hot and cold food stayed cold and was restocked diligently. Breakfast room staff were professional, polite, and friendly. Christmas Day the lines were extremely long but moved well. You shouldn't get bored with this breakfast since there are so many items that you can vary your selections every day. The pool area was wonderful. The pool appears to be small but once you're in, it is a good size and it's maintained well. The hot tub is good, too. You can order lunch or dinner from the window near the pool. The food was good, just a tad bit pricey, but convenient and satisfying. We visited Universal Studios which was about 8 miles away - the commute was easy. Downtown Disney is just a few minutes away as are the Disney parks. Shuttles are available from the hotel. The staff in the hotel lobby were very helpful with directions. This hotel is close to the Premium Outlets (shuttle available) but a bit of a drive to the Outlets on International Drive. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for any stay in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: idlebrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during our Christmas vacation. Suite we stayed is big enough with two queen beds separated from living area. Suite is clean and nice. Two big LCD TVs one in living, and one in bed room. In room safe is provided. Plenty of Free parking is available. Breakfast is boring with same items everyday. Very convenient to Disney Downtown area. Room has wired internet as well as wireless available. My only complaint is internet service priced at $8.99 for 24-hours. I managed internet with my iPhone. Even the business PC provided in the lobby area also charging $5.00. Otherwise its decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: r d
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 kids and I recently stayed for 4 nights. We generally prefer 3-4 star properties (we previously stayed at Wilderness Lodge); however, the savings we snagged by using a Mousesaver's discount was impossible to beat so we decided to give BVS a try. No complaints for the price. The night manager gave me directions as we were driving from the airport at midnight; the service at the breakfast cafeteria was friendly; and, the front desk sent someone to our room with a Phillips head screwdriver to assemble one of my son's new Disney toys. Obviously, this property get a lot of use, but our suite was in decent condition; I would suggest adding a towel ring by the sink. During our stay several of the guests around us were extremely loud and disruptive - I would have called the front desk for assistance, but we always travel with our white-noise machine which helps our kids fall asleep in any environment. The breakfast was above par for a similar hotel (coffee was bad, but I expected that), so the kids were able to fuel up every morning. We used the shuttle one day, but after spending an hour returning from the Magic Kingdom that night, we decided to drive our rental car. (The shuttle picks up at MK first and then makes a stop at each of the other parks before unloading at BVS .) It's a very easy drive to both MK and Epcot. For a fun and quick family trip - BVS fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay, again”
Reviews.Author: Mom2aidan01
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 sons & I stayed here sept. 28th-oct. 3. I have to say we loved it! My brother was staying in the penthouse at the Sheraton yet he came black to my room every night with his daughter. The rooms are very spacious & clean. The beds were very comfortable. I loved having a separate bedroom so the kids could sleep while the adults hung out. Having a fridge & a safe for no extra charge was great. Also, the free buffet breakfast was awesome! Kids could load up on breakfast & save us some money. The only complaint I have is that in the 5 days we were there they never served bacon. We flew in from Boston on Sept. 23rd. We stayed at a Disney hotel for the first 5 days for the convenience. We visited Universal from the Buena Vista Suites. It was a quick & easy drive, for us. We also used the complimentary $25 gift card to the hotel's restaurant for room service. The food was actually quite good. I brought it back to the room & before I was even able to unpack it there was a knock at the door. They had forgotten the dressing for my salad so they ran it up to me. ALL of the staff I dealt with were very friendly! Even the lady at the store gave me some plastic silverware so I wouldn't have to buy a whole box ( I only needed two forks). We were on the 7th floor facing the road. I gotta say, I couldn't hear a thing from outside, & I'm a light sleeper. We used the pool & found it clean & peaceful. If I had to list some complaints It would have to be the no bacon & the missing drawer pulls on my bureau. Also, the parking lot is a little deserted. My husband & brother are both police officers so we were safe but I would have been nervous, otherwise. I have read all of the bad reviews & I have to say I'm a little shocked. Our stay was great!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. We will definitely stay here, again the next time we are in Orlando!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Carol W
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want a reasonably priced and comfortable hotel. The beds were comfortable, but the pillows were not. The free full breakfast was one of the features that attracted us to stay here, but after a day or two, the same food was boring, and there wasn't enough variety. Scrambled eggs, potatoes, and some kind of meat. The pancakes were hard, so avoided them. The suite rooms were nice, but a bit snug. Our bathroom sink had a very slow drain. We told the front desk about it and they were going to get it worked on right away, but it didn't appear that anything was done on it. It would have been nice to have a few more shuttles to and from the parks, but we stayed in the off season, so perhaps there are more in the peak season. All in all, for the money, we recommend staying here if you're on a budget and you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and happy experience!”
Reviews.Author: redsoxlovr-7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had stayed here last year and we encountered some minor problems but we decided to give the hotel another chance and we are truly glad we did! The hotel was recommended by our subscription to "mousesavers" We reserved the "King deluxe Suite" for 8 nights and it was wonderful! We took advantage of the special for the 1st night at $89 and then every other night at $59 The room was spacious and the whirlpool tub was something that I had not tried and I found it relaxing after a long day at the parks! There was also a small refrigerator and a microwave that we found very convenient! We also took advantage of the "free" hot breakfast and the "free" transportation to the parks! The buses were comfortable and they were the big tour buses not the small shuttle buses! The schedule to the parks was very accommodating if you had small children and didn't want to stay at the parks all day! The hotel staff was wonderful and always greeted us with smiles everyday! I am so glad that we decided to try this hotel again and definitely will be back next year! This is truly a great value and you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with everything!”
Reviews.Author: karenj3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here due to the recommendation of "Mousesavers." At a rate of $89/night for a suite with two queen beds and a full breakfast, we were very satisfied. The room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. The hotel staff was very helpful, and the location was good. We did not try the free shuttle to the Disney parks because we had a rental car. The factory outlet mall is within walking distance. We stayed for 4 nights, and found a $50 food voucher at some travel website (maybe Expedia?) With it, the hotel gave us two $25 vouchers, and with careful menu selections, my husband and I were able to eat two dinners at the hotel restaurant for almost nothing. What a deal!! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Travelfishe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located near downtown Disney and outlet shopping center. However, you should have a car to get anywhere else than Disney because it is not within walking distance to ay store or restaurant. Upon our arrival, the personnel were polite and professionnal. Our room was large, clean and the bed was very confortable. The complementary breakfast buffet was nothing out of the ordinary but always well stocked with hot scramble eggs, ham or bacon, pancakes or french toasts, yogourt, oatmeal and what appeared to be fresh out the can fruits. It was also possible to have eggs, toast and bagel made to order. Back in our room, the fridge and microwave were clean and fully functionnal. The microware had a very strong smell of butter popcorn inside but thankfully our food did not get the smell. We did take advantage of the complementary shuttles, always on time, to Disney and the Premium outlet shopping center. Only a few minor negative things about the hotel. We stayed one week and would have love to have clean glasses at some point during our stay but the staff always left us with our used glasses. Did not complain about it. The hotel adhere to ecological practices but no matter where we hanged our towels, we always got fresh ones. The major drawback is the lack of services offered by the guest services desk. This may not be totaly related to the hotel as we had the feeling it is independently operated. Don't count on them to book a tour or for a return shuttle to the airport. The sell tickets and tickets only at regular prices. The only thing they have information on and rapidly offer are presentations to new hotels/timeshares for discounted tickets to various attractions of your choice. You better get organized before leaving home. We would stay again but rent a car to make our stay easier.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: My family stayed 5 days in November. We were impressed the moment we walked in the door at the friendliness of the staff. Our suite was spacious and comfortable. The housekeeping always arranged my sons stuffed animals on the bed when the made it. We used the refridgerator and microwave in the room frequently. The pool and hot tub are nice and the privacy fence is a plus. We used the hotel resturant for dinner one night and our waitress was not very good but the food was great. Breakfast was wonderful - scrambled eggs, the rotated meat daily (ham, sausgae, bacon), pancakes or french toast, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit. Made to order eggs, toast, and bagels. They also have juice, coffee, tea, and soda. The dining room is spacious and the staff is super nice. We used the shuttle to Disney and they always ran on time. There was a shuttle about every hour to different parks. The staff in the gift shop were so sweet! Those ladies were always friendly and interested in our day. We enjoyed our stay and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for families”
Reviews.Author: TanyaRad
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at the Buena Vista Suites from Nov 13-20, 2011. We were warmly welcomed at 1am by Ulysses and our room was ready and waiting. The room, called a suite, had a living room area with pull out couch and a bedroom with 2 queen beds. The 2 rooms were divided by the bathroom and vanity areas. Quite spacious compared to the Pop Century Disney Resort we had stayed at previously. The room was well equipped, clean and comfortable. The beds were very good. We were in 530 - facing the road, and there was some traffic noise, but it didn't keep us awake! The included breakfast buffet was basic but more than adequate and included eggs made to order, pancakes or french toast, and a meat choice as well as hot and cold cereal, bread, and fruit. Nothing fancy, but more than sufficient for the kids to fill up on before heading to the parks. We rented a car for the week as the shuttle did not run very frequently in the low season (see website for schedule). The location is very close to Disney World, 10 minute drive. We did use the shuttle once and it was right on time. We did swim in the pool a couple of times and it is very nice - plain, but clean and comfortable. Overall, I think this is a great hotel for the price. Given that we spent about 8-10 hours a day at the parks, this hotel met all of our needs. If you want to hang out at your hotel more, then maybe choose something a little fancier - but also more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Disney access”
Reviews.Author: kgstevens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buena Vista Suites for 3 nights in November 2011. It was our second time of staying at this hotel. We like the location--close to Disney without being in the very middle of the chaos. They offer shuttles to the park, though we opted to drive ourselves. The breakfasts (cooked to order/buffet) were good and were nice to fill up on before embarking on an amusement park adventure--complete with overpriced food. This is not a fancy or upscale resort, but we slept well and enjoyed the amenities during the very little time we spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service bad Security”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid P
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great clean and big suites, good free breakfast but the parking lot is not secure not enough security cameras so in our last day someone broke in our car and stole the GPS, camera and other goods so now we don't have pictures of our vacation. Advice for future guests do not leave anything of value in your cars or make sure it is locked and secure.:(

Reviews.Title: “Great price for Disney World”
Reviews.Author: gomergal
Reviews.Content: This was a great value for a hotel near Disney World. It was about 5-10 minute drive to Disney World. Close to a nice Walmart. Perfect location. The free breakfast was great. Really liked that the suite had a door in between the living area and the bedroom area. Was able to close the door and not have to listen to my husband snore. Kids liked that too!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: RhiannonsMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we needed. The 2 bedroom suite was cheap (always check mousesavers.com rates first), spacious, had a great selection (in my opinion) on the free breakfast buffet, close to Disney, great housekeeping, and comfortable beds. My husband's only complaint was that they didn't have sausage patties or biscuits on the buffet, but I felt that it was more than adequate for me and my daughter. I thought it was sweet how our housekeeper had arranged my daughter's stuffed animal on the bed. I can't comment on the pool area because we honestly didn't have time, but I will be returning to this hotel the next time we get to go back to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: seatheworldBoston
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by the basically 'ok' reviews of this hotel. I stayed for 3 nights in October (2011) and not only did we have ants in our room (even in our beds!) but when you really look around you can see how this hotel is being let go. The hot tub had screws sticking up and cracks in it - as did the pool. This place keeps the lobby ok and "appears" to be decent lodging - NOT the case! When I told the mgr on duty that I had ants in my room, all he had to say was: "thanks for letting us know". They didn't offer a thing in return...ants in our beds - how lovely. Granted we paid $89/night, but for ants in my room, I would think they should pay me to stay. Absolutely a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: KrebCycle
Reviews.Content: Went to Orlando for a conference held at Hotel Caribe next door to Buena Vista Suites. The conference had negotiated a rate with Hotel Caribe that was still $100 more than what could be had at BV Suites. The rooms were spacious, clean, and private although somewhat dated. The staff is friendly and helpful. Liked the pool and free breakfast (not your typical "continental buffet"). Cons: there is a Florida hotel "suite tax" added to your bill in addition to normal hotel fees. It runs about 3/night but I wasn't expecting it. The internet is 8.99/day. Next door at hotel caribe it is 9.99. They are owned by the same group. Weird? The hotel staff seems to have a racket going with the airport shuttle companies. I would recommend contracting your own taxi by using yellow pages rather than the front desk. My taxi from MCO to BV suites was $42 but my return trip on a charter shuttle was $58. Would stay there again if I had a conference in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fit our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Bill D
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights with my wife and 2 kids (13 &11). Hotel suites had plenty of space to stretch out and the 2 queen beds were very comfortable. The room was quiet and the free breakfast was okay. Hotel was very clean. Only downside was no free internet - not even in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “really good value”
Reviews.Author: wallyworld81
Reviews.Content: This is an all suite hotel. The hotel and property are well maintained. Disney hotels have become unaffordable for us and this hotel is a really good substitute. It is only 5 minutes from WDW property. The rooms are clean, the beds are very comfortable and the towels are nice. There are two large flat screen tv's in each suite. There is a free breakfast in the am which is adequate. The hotel is quiet and parking is ample. This was our 4th visit and we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DRMOLOKAI
Reviews.Content: Great rooms great breakfast great staff great pool and hot tub great pizza across street shuttle was ok but spend the $14 if u have a car much faster and more convenient

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: ilkeston
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at the Buena Vista Suites recently. We had room 509. Check in was a breeze and the staff was friendly. The size of the rooms are great for putting kids to bed and closing the door to the living room. I can't say the rooms are clean and I will elaborate shortly. The breakfast was excellent but got boring as they served the same things over and over. As one previous reviewer stated "Canned peaches and pears really!" The pool and hot tub are nothing to write home about and need work. Now here is the reason that this hotel is not great and a major issue. There is no exhaust in the bathrooms of the suites! My son used the bathroom and an hour later is still smelled. I checked the grille in the bathroom and there was no air movement. I assumed that the fan must be broken. Later that day in the shower I looked up and you could see mold on the ceiling. Further inspection showed mold on the walls mostly near the garbage can. You could even see where they had painted over the mold so they know its there! The next morning on the way to breakfast I asked to speak with a manager regarding this. He said "that it is hotel policy not to have fans in the bathrooms". I could only assume that the grille in the bathroom was for supply air from the heating/AC unit which means that air blows into the bathroom. This would also mean that any smell from the washroom would be forced out the door into the rest of the suite! The manager offered to move us to another room and I declined as we already had our things unpacked. He also asked if I wanted to elevate my complaint to a senior manager. It was all very nonchalant but this is a huge issue. This is mold we are talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Some pluses, Some minuses”
Reviews.Author: Tulip76
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room using the internet so checking in was a breeze. The front desk staff was friendly, courteous and informational. The bedroom itself appeared clean while the "living room" furniture contained stains and odors. I guess in the south it is also hard to escape the mildew-smelling shower curtains. Noise from the hallway was more than most places, but my room was not far from the elevators where people were getting off and rolling their suitcases across the tile to go to their rooms. I also had several disturbances from a rude family with small children who liked to run and yell down the hallways. The adults also tried to enter my room on at least 3 occasions by sliding their key cards into my door lock and then trying to open the door. This was not the hotel's fault that the people could not read the room numbers even though it was aggravating for me. When I decided to go to bed, I shut the door between the living room and the bedroom and didn't hear anything else the rest of the night. As for the other amenities - The fitness center has a multi-station weight machine (not maintained well), 2 treadmills, a stepper and a stationary bicycle. The aerobic machines all seemed in pretty good shape for their usage. There were plenty of towels and a water cooler available in the room. Parking was free and seemed to be ample. The business center, unlike most other hotels, cost $5 an hour to use. The free buffet breakfast was very nice. There was a selection of eggs (scrambled on the buffet, or cooked to order at the grill), sausage, pancakes, grits, oatmeal, pastries, cereals, fruit, yogurt, toast, beverages..... I am usually not much of a breakfast eater but I enjoyed it very much. Overall, this wasn't the best, nor was it the worst hotel experience I've had and I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Buena Vista Suites”
Reviews.Author: RaeannAZ
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at Buena Vista Suites. Each room is a suite with two HD tvs. Our room was very clean. It was great having a breakfast buffet before leaving the hotel for the day. Free shuttle service to all Disney parks was really a savings. If you took your car it cost $14 to park. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We would definitely stay at Buena Vista Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel Management Staff is all I can say.”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: Sad Sad experience. We pre paid our stay here which promised free internet. Upon checking in, they told us internet was NOT included. The first room we were place in had marks all over the walls, and the internet outlet was destroyed by either a previous guest, or, some other force of nature (wires hanging out of the wall). They changed us to another room, told us they would comp our entire internet for entire stay, yet, we were billed for internet upon check out. We approached management who went on to "grill us" about who "ok'd" the comping of our internet, blah, blah, blah, requesting documentation, when it was already placed into the system by the other manager.The management seemed to be disinterested, disconnected with its guests. Most of the staff had a hum drum poor attitude as well. My advice, steer clear of this place and find a hotel that has descent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey084
Reviews.Content: We found Buena Vista Suites a great place to stay that's convenient to Disney. We were able to get a great rate through mousesavers.com that made it very hard to pass up. Check-in/out was super easy. I booked it over the phone in just a few minutes and when we arrived it took maybe two minutes to complete check-in and get our key. The same with check-out. The suite was comfortable for a family of 5. The beds were comfy and it was nice having a seperate area for the children to watch TV during our time away from the parks. We usually stay at Disney resorts but we would probably stay here again. The only downside for me was the traffic noise at night. Although we were on the 6th floor I thought it was a bit loud..but the rest of my family did not even notice it . In all fairness though, every place that I have stayed aside from Disney resorts seems to have traffic noise issues. Orlando is just a busy area and that's to be expected. The breakfast area was nice. It offered a good variety that each day included: mini-donuts, grits, oatmeal, hashbrowns and cereal. They would also have either french toast or pancakes and ham, bacon or sausage links. It was decent, free and quick. The quality was *ok* at best...the children ate it without complaints. Afterall, we were there for the parks not to spend most the mornings at restaurants waiting for the check. The pool and spa area were nice and clean. It wasn't a giant pool with slides or anything, but the kids had plenty of fun. The hot tub was also nice after a day of walking around the parks. The staff was all very friendly and all of our needs were met with a smile, quickly and professionally. We go to Orlando at least 3 times a year and would gladly stay here again!.....and eat the breakfast :)

Reviews.Title: “Its ok...”
Reviews.Author: donna m
Reviews.Content: Here is my opinion.. The beds were comfy.. the 2 rooms are great.. tvs great.. BUT... listening to the traffic sucked all night and the buffet breakfast.. come on.. canned peaches, bad coffee, mini donuts that they got at the 7-11, instant oatmeal.. give me a break.. VERY disappointed... don't pay extra for their "free" breakfast.. there are resturants you can go to for cheaper and better near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel991
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. You are able to buy your Disney tickets there without having to wait in long lines at the parks. Free shuttles to and from the Disney Parks and also the Premium Outlet mall everyday. Free hot and cold breakfast everyday served buffet style. Excellent hotel and the price is very affordable. On Thursday's Buena Vista Suites offers discounts on their hotel through their website. Housecleaning staff was great, cleaned suite everyday, provided fresh towels and personal products. I will stay here every time I visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: uncle-eric
Reviews.Content: As with some of the other reviewers, we didn't want to have round the clock Disney (6-7 hours / day is enough, plus Disney properties are more expensive). So we chose this property which is located nearby Disney and within easy range of shopping etc. We saved enough compared to other options so we could have a rental car and still keep the budget lower than most other options. The rooms are all 1 bedroom suites and really fantastic value (we pretty much always prefer suite hotels). We had a late check in and Mr. Ulysses was on duty and he was just so friendly from check in and on through our visit. The pool etc. is not full power resort size, but at the same time is adequate since we're so burned out each day after returning from the parks. And if you think about it, the waterpark options in Orlando simply blow away any pool at any resort. The free breakfast is nothing special, but still a step above a lot of complimentary breakfast options. They have eggs (fresh cooked available but no omelets), meat (sausage, bacon, ham rotated daily), french toast, potatoes, and some fruits along with toast, donuts, and yogurt. Aside from being very well maintained, the rooms are soundproof, very functional with an extra sink / counter outside the bathroom, and feature real HD 42" TV's in both living and bedrooms along with very comfortable bedding and linens. We found this property on Mousesavers.com and suggest you check there for promotions. I'd highly recommend this property for folks who don't need opulence and are looking for an exceptional value without feeling like you've sacrificed anything. Happy Traveling

Reviews.Title: “Very CLEAN, Beautiful, friendly staff and awesome housekeepers!:)”
Reviews.Author: l0vemyrtlebeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my husband and 3 small children. We usually stay on Disney Property when we visit Central Florida, but we didn't want the 24 hour Disney Experience. This was our first time staying the Buena Vista Suites, and we were wonderfully surprised! This was a beautiful hotel, very clean, and excellent service! The front desk lady, Gardina, was awesome. They had a full free breakfast every morning, the beds were very comfortable, and the pull out sofa in the living room was great as well. We had 2 big flat screen TVs, granite counter tops, etc. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “newly renovated, very large size, great stay”
Reviews.Author: mountainman1154914
Reviews.Content: the room was very large with 2 x 42"HD LCD tv which was great with the kids as i would watch a show in another room while they would watch their tv show in another room. the beds were very comfortable, nice modern furniture. even though breakfast was provided, it was only OK (had better quality at other hotels) but still did the job. my only concern was our room was facing world drive which was quite noisy even on our 6th floor where we stay. also, our room as next to an elevator which again you can hear it. so make sure you request a room away from an elevator or facing busy street if you prefer a quiet suite. price was very decent. location was great. only 5 minutes to premium outlet store (good buys, should check it out!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: canarytraveler
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent deal on this hotel through MouseSavers.com which included free full breakfast and Internet. The hotel is literally within 5-10 minute drive from Disney parks and about 15 min. drive from Universal. The suites are an unbeatable value for a family of 4 - they separate bedroom with 2 beds and a small living room area with a pull-out couch, so mom and dad can share a bed and each child can have a room. The rooms are very clean and well cared for, the housekeeping is attentive, everything worked, no complaints whatsoever. The beds and pillows are comfortable and we never heard any noise. Breakfast was excellent: scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage or ham, hash browns (always very good), pancakes or french toast, grits and oatmeal, 2 types of cereal, fruit and yogurt. Plus you could get eggs cooked to order and get toast and bagels toasted. It really was a very nice variety - we neer tired of this breakfast and it was a great meal before hitting the parks. Another great advantage is a very large seating area - we never had a problem finding a table, even with 2 high school bands staying there :) The staff was always nice and courteous. We aslo used the pool in the evening and the water was warm and clean. There is a small restaurant on the premises where we ate once since we arrived late and everything was very good and prices were reasonable. We really enjoyed our stay and this will be our #1 choice when we are back in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: CasB57
Reviews.Content: We found Buena Vista Suites to be a great place to stay. The room was very clean and we had absolutely no problem with noise from other guests. The staff of the hotel and those on the theme park counter could not have been more helpful. The included breakfast was fantastic, the pool was very relaxing and the free shuttle to Downtown Disney was a bonus. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Suzy9716
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights there and the stay was great! The breakfast was really good. The hotel is very near to all the parks and also close to outlet shopping. Opposite is a pharmacy and a doctor's office ( which we had to use). I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: l0vemyhusband
Reviews.Content: Buena Vista Suites offers a special deal every Thursday (we got a room for $89 a night) on their website or by calling. My family and I stayed 5 nights. The room was clean and the extra space it offered was nice. It is very close to Walt Disney World and Sea World. The breakfast was ok, quality could have been better...but can't complain too much because it was free! The hotel offers free parking which is nice, most hotels in the area charge a parking fee on top of the nightly room rate. Pool area was clean. You can get to the pool from the main lobby or go to an out -of- the- way stairwell which I didnt care much for. The only complaint was that the bedroom with 2 queen beds was tight.. had to get in from side of bed that was away from the wall. Air conditioner was very quiet, but could hear traffic. Overall, I would visit again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: justnikki99
Reviews.Content: PROS: *Check-in was fast and the staff was courteous; We arrived very early (around 7am) and our room was ready for us without requesting early check-in. Also, they sent up some complimentary desserts in honor of our upcoming wedding. (How nice!) *The suite was perfect for our family (2 adults, 3 small kids). It was roomy and clean. *The housekeeping staff were very nice and professional; The room was cleaned daily. Fresh towels and sheets were also provided daily. My husband lost his wedding ring and at the end of the day upon our return, they found his ring and placed it on the dresser for us. *Breakfast was good and had a variety of items to choose from. *The shuttle to Disney was comfortable, on time and the drivers were very nice. The only CON would be the air conditioner. It was not as cool as we wanted to be, and made it harder to get to sleep. Overall, we had a great experience here. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Optimum Value”
Reviews.Author: mgc88
Reviews.Content: I spent a week to search best hotel at minimum cost. And I think I found right one. check in was superfast, free breakfast buffett, convenient location, free parking, reasonable rate, comfortable bed w/ good room services.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: qbanchula04
Reviews.Content: It is located just perfectly if you are going to go to Disney. I loved the whirpool tub we had in our suite(it was our favorite part). The complimentary breakfast was also a great value. The staff was very helpful although I wouldn't say professional. It was a little annoying when we first arrived and they gave us a suite with no whirlpool, but they fixed the issue rather quickly. Also, there were some stains in the sofa of our suite but the bed sheets were clean. Overall it was enjoyable. Great for families and, can't say it enough, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel near Disney Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: ParryFamily
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel based on Trip Advisor reports. I was looking for a good hotel near the Disney Theme parks which offered free parking and complimentary breakfast. The hotel lived up to my expectations. The accommodation allocated to the three of us (wife, daughter and me) consisted of a large room containing a separate bedroom and sitting room. Both rooms had large flat screen hi def TVs and the sitting room also include a fridge, microwave and bed settee. Having the separate sitting room was great! There is a small pool to the side of the property which was well maintained and used. Getting to the Theme Parks was straight forward, basically turn right out of the hotel and go straight on. It was also easy to access Disney Downtown area from the hotel. The free buffet breakfast was very good considering the price. My daughter particularly liked the hot chocolate. I donâ€™t think this hotel is unusually for hotels in the area but if you want to eat out you will have to drive as you canâ€™t walk to a nearby restaurant. I would advise against using the hotel room service as the person who served us on the first night was quiet unpleasant and unfortunately left me with a a bad impression of the place, hence the star rating

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsRight
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy this hotel and have stayed here on two separate Disney vacations. The rooms are spacious and we really like to have a door between the bedroom area and the living area. We have two small boys and it was nice to be able to prepare lunches for the next day while they slept. The breakfast has a great variety of items and the staff is very friendly. Some of the items tasted a bit cafeteria quality, but everyone in our family was able to find things they enjoyed. The breakfast includes: donuts, eggs, a daily meat choice: sausage, bacon, or ham, eggs, oatmeal, pancake/french toast. Eggs and toast to order, cereal, juice, fruit, coffee, Coca-Cola products, milk. The shuttle bus is a nice amenity and we did use them on our first visit. They make a few trips each day, but we wanted a bit more flexibility due to our young children and chose to rent a car the second trip. We liked the free parking! The pool is okay, but we were so tired after Disney days that we didn't use it very much anyway. Pizza place across the street, Gourmettos, has excellent pizza and breadstick knots!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 22my
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. The rooms were large and were clean. The staff was very kind and helpful. We would definately stay at this hotel again, but would call and make sure no youth groups were staying at the same time, as they kept us up most of the night. The front desk did a good job trying to keep them quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: krankn
Reviews.Content: Positives: Room is spacious with great features like the fridge, microwave and TV in each room. Easy and quick access to interstate and Disney right down the highway. Restaurants nearby. Generous breakfast buffet. Negatives: beds were uncomfortable and towels were a bit rough. We were disappointed we weren't able to use the complimentary shuttle because the departure times didn't fit our schedule (shuttle is not continuous)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: CASue_7
Reviews.Content: The Buena Vista Suites was an excellent choice for my husband and myself. It is close to everything Disney (about 1 mile) and other things as well. Loved, loved, loved the "suite" arrangements. So nice to have a separate bedroom since I go to bed earlier than my husband . . .even on vacation. Furnishings were beautiful and it isn't very often that I can say the bed was very comfortable. They provide a very nice breakfast INCLUDED in the price of the room (which was already reasonable) and while it was crowded at breakfast - we expected that at any kid friendly area, seating was always available and plenty of choices to pick from. Staff was friendly and helpful. We would highly recommend this hotel to a couple or a family.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Fluency
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful. We stayed in a suites that fit a family of five very well. House keeping did a great job and free breakfast had a nice selection of items. Location to the Walt DIsney World Parks was very close and convient. Very nice selection of family restaurants close to the hotel. (fast food & sit down) We got a great rate with Advance Purchase for the 4th of July weekend. Would recommend this hotel for anyone that is traveling on a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms great, breakfast stunk!”
Reviews.Author: American-liv-n-China
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great. They are big (2 queen beds and 1 queen sofabed) and fit the 4 adults and 2 kids we had very comfortably. The bed are okay, the 2 large flat screen tvs were great but there was not in the selection of free toiletries but I'm use to traveling in Asia where hotel service is superior than that in the states. Breakfast buffet stunk. It felt like a low class diner. So don't get you're hopes up. You might as well cross the street and buy a doughnut at the 7-Eleven and skip what this hotel serves. The taste is bland and there wasn't much of a selection. It's free with lots of guests so that is why the quality of the breakfast wasn't that great. But other than the breakfast, the hotel was perfect for resting and close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Just a night out w my bff”
Reviews.Author: tampa2211
Reviews.Content: i stay at this hotel or its sister, the caribe royale, everytime im in orlando. the room is great. the staff is friendly, and i never have any problems with anything. the bed was extremely comfortable as well..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Breakfast Buffet for Free!!”
Reviews.Author: Hinditina
Reviews.Content: We live about an hour away from Disney but we were going to a conference on Diseny property and did not want to drive back and forth. So we stayed a somewhere near Disney property. We were pleasently surprise by our room. We had a microwave and a refig. The bed was so comfortable and the pillows are nice. We were extermely surpirse about the breakfst next morning. We figure it was the typical donut, cereal, a waffle maker with little cups for jucies. Nope. Not the case. You had chocies of oatmeal, grits, scramble eggs, sauage, pancakes. if you wanted eggs overeasy or meduim made for you they will make it. And toast your bread. The coffee was delicous! Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Rbarcenas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for six nights from June 7th to June 13th. Check in was very easy and fast. We got to our room and unfortunately we were given a beaten up room on the 4th floor that smelled like sewer, walls were dirty, and just did not look like the pics on the internet. The next morning the manager moved us into a different room on the 5th floor which was excellent and more in line with what we had seen on their website. We also received a complimentary voucher for free food to compensate for the inconvenience. The two spacious rooms, two flat screen TV's, fridge, and mircrowave our definitely a plus. We did have some minor issues that were immediately corrected by the staff. I was not able to access internet for two days until I called the techinician and he hard coded me into their system through the end of my stay, from that point forward I had no issues as long as I used my laptop in the living room. The room was very clean, the only problem was housekeeping for some reason did not like to replace shampoo, conditioner, and some of the coffee supplies that we were using. We had to call and request these on our own. Somehow we had very bad luck with our keys that were demagnitized so after about four times, they had a technician take a look at the door lock and after that we had no problems getting in. The breakfast was fine just gets a little old after a while because they serve the same selection everyday with the exception of alternating pancackes and french toast. The pool was nice, but not the greatest. I specifically asked if we could use the pool next door at the Gran Caribe because I had a five year old that would really enjoy the water slide and was told NO, yet I have seen reviews now from others that were there at the same time and they were allowed to use the pool, so that is very dissapointing. We didn't use the shuttle service as we had our own car. The CVS and other small shops and restaurants across the street are very conveinient. We found that the hotel was a lot closer to Disney World than we expected. Overall the service was great, they corrected minor issues promptly. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: piscesleo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 5 year old stayed from 8th May 2011 to 14th May 2011 and thought it was a great place to stay.The rooms were spacious and clean and complimentary breakfast was good.We didn't use the pool or the shuttle bus to the parks ( we had a car). We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Courtney H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buena Vista Suites while we were in town to visit Disney World. We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and would definitely recommend it to others who are traveling in the area. When you compare the price of this hotel to one of the Disney resorts, the difference is staggering. Our total for 5 nights was about $550 and we had room for 6 to sleep comfortably. This hotel also offers free shuttles to all of the Disney Parks, so that part is covered as well. We didn't actually use the shuttles because we wanted the freedom to come and go when we wanted, but they were available and the time schedules were printed with 4 or 5 departure times and as many return times. They didn't offer as many shuttles to every park, but there were at least 2 shuttles to every park each day. The parking at Disney is $14 for all day and you can come and go as you want for that price- to any park. Check-in was simple and quick and the hotel staff was very helpful and courteous. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Our room was the 2-queen lay-out, which had 2 queen beds in the bed room and a queen sofa sleeper in the living area, separated by a door that can be closed if needed. In the center of the room, there is a bathroom with a vanity and sink outside the door, which is handy when you have multiple people who are getting ready at once. The room also had 2 flat panel televisions- one in the bedroom and one in the living area. This was very nice as well, given the wide array of tv programs everyone in our family prefers. The breakfast each day was excellent. It was not only great because it was FREE, but also because of the options you had. The first day they offered scrambled eggs, sausage links, french toast, and potatoes on the buffet bar. They also had fresh fruit, yogurt, doughnuts, bagels, dry cereal, and toast. For drinks, they offered orange juice, milk, chocolate milk, coffee, and 6 kinds of soda. They also prepared toast for you and prepared eggs to order. The dining room was large and easily could hold 150 at a time, so there was never an issue finding a table, even though we were in Orlando during a busy week. This free breakfast saved us a bundle in 5 days. A similar breakfast would be $10 per person easily. We have 7 total family members (including our 2-year-old) so the breakfast alone for 5 days would come to $350. I know the Disney resort offers meal plans, but I also know they charge a high price for them, so this free buffet breakfast pretty much sealed the deal. I've noticed some others reviewing this hotel have said there is no free internet. I checked with the front desk and was told to type in my confirmation # in the box when logging in and ours would be free- and it was. I suppose this is only applicable when you stay a minimum number of nights. We stayed 5 nights, so you might ask about that. Otherwise, the price would have been 8.95 per 24-hour period. The pool was excellent as well. The configuration was nice because it offered 2 shallow ends and the center of the pool was the deepest, so our smaller children were able to swim on either end. The pool also offered a take-out window from the restaurant that was on-site. The prices were not too terribly high, but we were operating on a budget and didn't take advantage of this option. They also had a hot tub/whirlpool which my wife utilized. It was a large, 8-man whirlpool about 30-40 feet away from the main pool and my wife said it was very nice. Overall, we were very pleased with everything. We saved about $2000 between the room cost and the breakfast and I don't think we sacrificed very much in the way of comfort and amenities. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible internet service and average customer service.”
Reviews.Author: kdjl
Reviews.Content: Although we were in Orlando for a family trip, I did have business to conduct via the internet. I wasn't pleased when we discovered that there's an additional cost for internet access. Considering the charge, I'd thought that our access would be be be flawless. Unfortunately, we had a weak signal and were moved to another room. Although the signal was better, it was extremely slow. Considering that access was an additional charge, I was very disappointed in the service. The hotel itself was o.k. It was a little dark and in need of some renovation. The staff didn't go out of their way to be helpful. It appeared they were just there for a paycheck and ready to go home. Attitude makes a big difference in the hospitality industry. If you're in need of a hotel and pressed for time, I'd recommend this hotel. However, if you have time to search for another hotel, I'd recommend finding place somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable and great value”
Reviews.Author: gopack32
Reviews.Content: very clean. Suites were large.We loved the door between the bedroom and sitting area. Free full buffet breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSB_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as part of a vacation package via US Airways. The good: The place was clean, the room was spacious, the check in and check out were easy. It is conveniently located to several major arteries and not far from Disney. Breakfast was included. There is a nice little outdoor pool. You can buy tickets for parks in the hotel lobby. The less good: elevator that tended to be slow (since we were on the 3rd floor, we just took the stairs a lot). The sink for the bathroom was not necessary in a convenient place either, in the middle of the suite with carpet floor. And the breakfast buffet was less than appealing food wise (plenty of food but they really need to send their cook to culinary school as some of it was frankly nasty). The guy who sold us the tickets for Disney was extremely obnoxious (but I just think it was lack of luck on my part as what I saw the following days were much quieter and subdue salespeople). Overall, a decent place. I would recommend it for a family as the rooms are quite spacious. As part of the vacation package, it was a pretty nice value too.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Gardenia for a wonderful experience at your resort!”
Reviews.Author: willp1985
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were guests from May 4-5, 2011. We had booked 3 King deluxe suites, for our entire family . The experience that we had was amazing due to Gardenia Starling. She took care of every detail from the rooms being next to each other, sending up an extra bed for our daughter immediately, giving our children tokens to play in the arcade, chocolates in every room along with a card welcoming us, and to cap it off we were also given complementary drinks downstairs that evening. What more could we ask for? She thought of things we had never expected! The customer service and personal touch that Gardenia brought to our stay made us feel very special. We are Disney annual passholders and we normally stay at one of the deluxe resorts. That being said, the experience that Gardenia gave to us surpasses the Disney standard. .

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great restaurant for dinner”
Reviews.Author: biilsusan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights @ Buena Vista Suites. It was a clean, well maintained hotel. The parking was free as was a breakfast buffet. The breakfast buffet was limited but good with fresh hot food. To get to the small pool, you would have to go to the 2nd floor & walk down the stairs or walk through the main lobby. It was outside of the restaurant. The hotel lobby bar wasn't open, but the restaurant bar was open. The rooms were dark. The only window is in the bedroom of the suite. Overall, all of the staff that we came in contact were very accomodating & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Facility which does exactly what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: curaghill123
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure all staff were warm and Friendly. Rooms spacious ,spotless,quiet and well equipped.Food and service at all mealtimes excellent in quality and value.Mr Crumpton the GM has a fantastic team of staff who exibit a constant willingness to go beyond the call of duty to fulfill special requests.Would highly recommend and will definatly return. Many thanks for a fantastic Wedding anniversary week. Kevin and Sheila Mc Manus. Ramada loughallen Hotel, Leitrim Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Too many negative incidents = Never returning”
Reviews.Author: hayohiou
Reviews.Content: We were here for 2 nights during a Charity Bicycle Event. Through our event we paid $99 a night. The good: The room was very nice. Large couch area, big TVs nice king bed, fridge, microwave. Mostly friendly staff. The bad: Where do I begin... $8.99 for use of the internet on your own computer...really?? Got our check in date wrong: wasn't that big of a deal, they fixed it right away. Went to front desk to ask for scissors because I forgot to bring my own. Front desk would not let me take them to the room even if I left my drivers license. So I had to bring down what I needed to cut-- at this point a little bothered but not that bad yet. Forgot to put a shower chair in the bathroom for my husband who is in a wheelchair-not that big of a deal, they brought one after I called. BUT then my husband tried to transfer on to it but it was so unstable that he could not sit on it.--Really Really annoyed by that. No wake up call that we requested. Thank goodness I set the alarm so we did make it on time.--really really annoyed by that. Go to get breakfast for my husband who is unable to come down stairs at that point to get his own due to his disability. I go in and get a plate for him. I go to the elevator and an manager (I think) opens the door quickly from the back and states to me "you need to eat in the dining room." I explained why I was bring the food to my room and he said "well, I didn't know that." Then proceeded to rudely state "you need to tell us that so that we can give you a to go box". I have never heard of a hotel not letting you take the continental breakfast to you room so I was unaware of this crazy policy. NEVER again will I stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: travelbug323
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and toddler stayed a night in this hotel for a trip to Magic Kingdom. We had an excellent experience throughout. The front desk was incredible firendly and helpful; even letting us check in early. The room was very spacious with a seperate living area. It had a refrigerator, microwave and had a large flat screen TV in bedroom and living area. The bed was very comfortable; they also provided a pack and play for my toddler which was a plus. Breakfast buffett was well stock and was a great value for being included in hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favourite hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: royfleming
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 7-14, can't say enough good about this place. Got a fantastic deal on the rooms (Google around, and check their website for their one-day weekly specials). Great sleeping due to excellent bedding and the fact the bedroom is further separated from the hallway by the living room and an interior door. A/C worked great, much better than other Orlando hotels - and not humid. Free Breakfast was decent... yes, on weekdays the fruit was limited to tinned peaches or pears, but if you need fresh fruit the 7-11 across the street has some at a good price. CVS also directly across street. Great experience with staff, they went out of their way to be helpful. Good experience with reservations staff on phone also, as I had to make a couple of changes. Pool very clean and nice, and food available poolside is EXCELLENT (albiet a bit pricey). Recommend your own car, easy drive to all Disney parks and ok for Universal also. Room had secure safe in closet (you set our own code), small fridge, microwave and coffeemaker. Good TVs, though we didn't watch it much. The back side of the hotel (facing the parking lot/forest) is quieter than the front, and if you look hard you can see Downtown Disney and the Epcot globe. Optional wi-fi is expensive, but they tell you that up front. Most McDonald's have free wifi locally if you really need it. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to where you want to be in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: dawsjam
Reviews.Content: Just left Buena Vista Suites as our vacation time in Orlando came to an end. Really enjoyed our time at the hotel. We arrived at MCO and had a hire car. 15 minute drive to the hotel and was greeted very well and very quickly checked in. Pool nice (whirlpool not great but was plenty hot enough). Small shop in hotel for souvenirs and essentials. Also a 7-11 across the road. Disney parks very close (3 miles away). The hotel does a shuttle service but we had a hire car so can't comment on that. Universal studios & Sea World also very close (international Drive is only round the corner). Breakfast was a repetitive but can be handled. Room cleaned each day, fresh towels always available at the pool. All in all we would recommend staying there again. Good deals through expedia.com. Very friendly staff and wouldn't hesitate booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel would be perfect, if it had a completely new staff”
Reviews.Author: monimomlg
Reviews.Content: The staff is terrible, plain and simple. The hotel itself, rooms, pool, location, GREAT, the staff will make you run. I called at 11pm to let them know i will be checking in at around 5 or 6 am( we were driving from wi with 2 small kids) the man i spoke to said that will be ok. Well when we arrived we were greeted by an arrogant rude man wish i remembered his name but he's the third shift guy. Anyway the way he talked to my mother was beyond belief, very disrespectful, surprised he still has a job. I was not going to let some jerk talk to my mother that way so i asked to speak to a manager and some girl comes out and didn't speak once after i told her what happened, didnt even apologize. The third shift guy on the other hand did apologize in such a way i wanted to smack him. He said well im sorry your mother didnt understand what i was saying and basically calling my mother a liar. Anyway i know they video tape the lobby so i hope this gets in the right hands of maybe the real manager and they review the tapes and let go of those two. They should not be in costumer service. Btw i managed a hyatt for ten years, so i know the expectations hotels of this caliber should have.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: momtomillie
Reviews.Content: Room was very quiet, even with a floor full of teenage girls! And we were right across from the elevators. Our family of 2 adults and 3 teenagers had no problem with space management. Only downside was internet was not provided. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdotdesign
Reviews.Content: The hotel was down the street from the Convention that we were attending. The reception team was welcoming and nice. The rooms were very nice. I had a suite just for one person, so I did not take advantage of the living room area. There was not free WiFi. The bathrooms were very clean. I left my charger and the house keeping staff returned it by mail promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Berkeley_IL
Reviews.Content: The suite is a perfect set up-little fridge, microwave in a separate area. Sink & mirror outside toilet & tub. Super comfy queen beds. Very quiet room.
