Breakfast was great- they sunnyside your eggs for you! The location is perfect to Disney. JUST off property closest to EPCOT. We were traveling w/80 year old Mom; we didn't need handicap room but wish the toilet were "comfort/ handicap height" and/or had a hand rail to help get up.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable for the price”
Reviews.Author: SteveFromIowa
Reviews.Content: Loved this motel. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. I slept better than I do at home. The seperated bedroom and living room allowed me to get dressed and leave without waking up my wife in the mornings. The breakfast was great. The only negative was that there were a couple of bus loads of teens staying at the motel when we were there. Consequently, we stayed away from the pool. We were only a few minutes drive to anywhere on the Disney complex. The price was well below other motels that I checked in the area and the amenities were better. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average to Fair Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zatraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 3 nights with my family (daugher -5). This hotel is okay - definitely nothing tpo write home about. The pool was not heated! It was freezing. The rooms were a bit too small for a family of 4. The staff was aveage. I found the front desk very rude when I complained 4 times that my room lock was not working properly. The breakfast was not the greatest, but was a good start for a long day for one of the theme parks. No I would not stay there again. I have stayed at Carib Royal which is on the same complex. Much better facility. Wireless was too expensive and Business Centre charges $5.00 per half hour - rip off!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not such a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rockland_ta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after finding a great rate for a hotel that offered a suite. Being able to make a right out of the parking lot and going straight into WDW was great. Plenty of stores across the street and down either side of the road. You do need to rent a car to stay there though. Otherwise you are dependent on the hotels shuttle service and cabs. The room was nice enough. It gave my wife and I our own bedroom and a nice size living room with a pull out couch and pack n play for our kids. The fridge in the room was a great. We had no problems with the cleaning staff. One morning we had a late start due to a morning rain storm. They cleaned our side of the hallway already. We weren't expecting them to clean our room since we were so late coming back, but to our great surprise they did. Also every night they made the pull out couch and left it open for us. The one bad thing about the hotel was the food selection in the free breakfast. It was lacking choices. No english muffins, no bacon, no cheese. Pancakes were every other day. Next time I would probably stay next door at their sister property, but if the rate is a good one, I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Large Family”
Reviews.Author: rvirata2006
Reviews.Content: We were 4 adults and 2 kids and stayed in the 1 bdrm 2 queen suite that sleeps 6. It was a little cramped with 4 adults, but would be perfect for a family of 2 adults and 4 kids. The room was gorgeous and very clean. Beds were comfy and even the sofa bed was nice. Would stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tonmcgwn1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel. My boys loved the full court basketball court and the gameroom. The rooms was great and sleeps very well. I will highly recommend this hotel. I rented a car and was able to attend not only Disney but Universal Studios. The buffet breakfast was great to get the morning started and the hotel is in an excellent location. Overall, I will give this hotel a 5++++.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if going to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Rafiki63
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel to stay at. Certainly a convenient place to stay when visiting Disney theme parks. My partner and I would like to thank Renae (the hotelâ€™s concierge) for making our holiday activities so well organized and memorable. This woman is such an upbeat, giving person who wanted us to have the best experience at Disney World. And we did. Every morning before we ventured off we would speak to her for an hour or so about the previous days activities and what her personal experiences were like. She embraced our Australian background and greeted us every morning with such enthusiasm. Was definitely a sad moment saying goodbye. All hotel amenities were exceptional, including breakfast and the basketball/tennis facilities. 5 star concierge service. Highlight of our USA trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not what they say”
Reviews.Author: chicago25624
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to The Magic Kingdom, with kids, this is NOT the place to stay. They claim in their brochure, they are 1 1/2 miles from the Walt Disney Resort. That may be a the crow flies, but explain to me how a 1 1/2 mile trip costs $20. There is LIMITED shuttle service to Disney World, Animal Kingdom, etc., and a taxi is $20-$25 each way. DO NOT fall for the discounted tickets scam in the lobby. I was told, by the man at the desk, if I bought the tickets at Disney, the total would be $838 for 2 kids, and 2 adults, for 2 days at Disney, if I listened to their sales pitch the next day. He would save me $313, for a total of $525. I passed, as I wasn't going to sit through a pitch, and I had researched tickets and knew the cost would be $664 if I bought the tickets at Disney. Would I have saved some money? Yes. But I don't deal with liars and cheats. Our queen suite was very cramped with 2 adults, a 4 yr old, and a 6 yr old. The restaurant wait staff is painfully slow and does not listen. We ordered dinner on our 2nd night and it took 15 minutes for our drink order to be taken. Another 23 minutes for our dinner order to be taken. And then 25 minutes before our food arrived. There were 3 tables of 5 or less in the restaurant and this was the service we got. On our last night there, I went down to order a kids chicken tenders meal, with chocolate ice cream, a burger, and a Buena Vista salad, with 1 additional drink and an additional cup of vanilla ice cream. There were 2 families in the dining room at that time. While waiting for our food, on 3 occasions men came to the bar to order a drink, only to leave after 1 for 5 minutes, and 2 for 10 minutes because no one was behind the bar to wait on them, or servers asking if they could help. That's 25 minutes of me waiting for my food. And then when I get it and get back to the room, the kids meal was wrong, the ice cream was wrong, and the drinks were wrong. If you are there for business this may be OK for you. If you are a family, stay clear.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Disney World Trip”
Reviews.Author: marcikneid
Reviews.Content: We recently took our young children, ages 6 & 8, to Disney World for a week... this hotel was perfect for our us... free parking, free breakfast every day, room service each day to empty trash, make beds, tidy up, bring new towels. The location couldn't have been better, not too far from the airport, yet only a mile and a half from the Disney World entrance, actually located on the same road as Disney's entrance so it was super easy to find. Would recommend a gps for your car trips to/from the airport, and for finding your way home at night from the parks just as a backup (another genius idea is the hotel is lit up at night so its easy to locate). There were free shuttles for the parks each day but we didn't use them so I really can't comment on them, we used our own car to get around. The morning breakfast was wonderful, so much to choose from, lots of hot items, bacon, sausage, french toast, hash browns, pancakes, eggs cooked to order, fruit, cereal, coffe, tea, milk, juice, donuts, bagels, toast, etc. Our kids can only eat all natural foods, so having the eggs, fruit and bagels was perfect for us. The cooks are happy to check labels for you if you have a food sensitivity. The room looked exactly as presented on the website, to the tee, nice and modern, comfy luxurious beds, loved having a seperate living area from the sleeping area so we could spread out a little and have a more home-y atmosphere to relax. The size of the room was perfect for the 4 of us. I would definitely be happy to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We love this Hotel and will return next year..”
Reviews.Author: leigh12
Reviews.Content: Wow, very nice hotel i must say..We had travel for 16 hrs staraight before getting into the orlando area. We arrived at 7am on a Tuesday morning, couldn't check into the pool house we had reserved until on Wednesday, so we seen this hotel, and went into see if we could get a room. The staff was very nice being so tired they let us go ahead and get a room that early and only charged for one day. The room is very new updated, beds were very comfortable, couldn't hear anything from the other rooms, the breakfast was AWESOME, and FREE, the one thing i noticed about it was not only did they have the normal breakfast drinks like, coffee, mik, juice but they also had coke products you couldnt find that anywhere else. Only regreats we had was not staying here longer, we love it and will be back in 2012

Reviews.Title: “A good and fair, stay. Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NX-01a
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Buena Vista for 18 nights in January 2011 so it was a long period and we were able to know the hotel day to day routine well (and night to night too) . As the suite has a door that closes to the first room, you can close it at night and enjoy a quiet night of sleep, beds are good and with a bigger size that the ones at the Fairfield were I used to stay, me and my wife were comfortable in one and the two kids comfortable in the other one. The breakfast is included and it's also good, nothing fancy but a good addition for free. The location is the best thing about this hotel, it's like a hub to 535, I4 and all the other important roads to take to all the locations. Leaving the hotel and turning right, you go straight ahead and in 5 minutes you are at Disney, Premium Outlet at Vineland Ave. is also 5 minutes away just one right turn more. The rooms has two LCD TV's so you can watch your programs while the kinds can enjoy theirs. It also has a small fridge and a small microwave but it has only one sink, the same one that you use to wash your hands and teeth so I found a little complicated to eat in the room or cook anything. The only complaint that I have is about the internet service, in my opinion the wi-fi connection offered is expensive ($8.90 per each 24h) and slow (I only got 512mb). This service should be better and for a better price. All in all you are looking for an hotel with good price and value and awesome location, this one is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average but good for night owls with children.”
Reviews.Author: foxmanb71
Reviews.Content: Whenever we drive over to Disney or Universal for a few days, we usually stay at the Buena Vista Suites or the Caribe Royale, which are next door to each other. I like to have the extra living room because I stay up late to read and/or watch t.v. and it doesn't disturb the wife and kids who go to bed earlier. I usually make the choice based on which is cheaper. No more! Buena Vista Suites is a cheaper, smaller, dirtier version of the Caribe Royale. When we checked into our room, my son noticed the t.v. wasn't working. I contacted the front desk and immediatley sent someone to repair it. We then noticed that the toilet wasn't working. I contacted the front desk immediately and they sent someone to repair it. Not a great start but at least they were responsive. The extra living room was nice to have, which is one of the main reasons I stay there or the Caribe Royale, but the furniture is a little run down. The coffee table weighs about a thousand pounds and you can't move it around if you want some legroom by the couch. I also found the bed to be pretty uncomfortable, but that may be because i'm used to a king and our room had 2 queens. The free breakfast is ok but it's very basic, usually including powdered eggs, bacon, sausage, rubbery pancakes, fruit, juice, coffee, milk, and doughnuts. In the end, The Buena Vista Suites is a smarter and cheaper alternative then staying at a disney hotel but i would recommend staying next door at the caribe royale and spend the extra money if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blacksandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked well for our needs. Just down the road from the entrance to Disneyworld. The staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was so so. Pretty much the same every morning. I would not hesitate to stay again, but would get a room not facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ChanClan2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a Disney trip for 4 nights. We got a room w/ 2 queen beds in the bedroom and another sofabed in the living room. It was perfect for me, my husband, and our 2 kids - ages 6 and 12. The beds were very comfortable and I liked that there was a TV in the bedroom as well as another in the living room. We can only watch so much Disney channel! There was a microwave and a mini-fridge as well, but the fridge was not the really small model so it held everything we needed. The service was excellent - everyone at the front desk was very nice and the people cleaning and restocking the breakfast area were very friendly. Breakfast was great. There was always cereal, fruit, and eggs. When we were there, they alternated between french toast and pancakes, and also between sausage and ham. It is a great alternative to a Disney hotel, especially if you like a suite and free breakfast. They have scheduled shuttle to all 4 Disney parks and Downtown Disney but sometimes it can take a while to get to the park or get back to hotel because they usually go to all 4 theme parks on each trip. It once took almost an hour to get there. However, the bus seats are very comfortable and they have tv's on the buses playing kid's movies so the kids didn't really mind. If you have really antsy kids who can't handle a longer shuttle ride, I would just pay the $14 to park at Disney. The only other drawback was that wi-fi wasn't free - 8.99/day. It was actually a plus for us because our 12 year old couldn't stay glued to her Ipod touch all day. Overall, I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Live like royality without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: JaneLO
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! My family and I have stayed here for the past 3 years while my husband attended a conference in Orlando. The kids and I went to Disney World. The hotel offers wonderful charter bus service to Disney. There is a great buffet breakfast with hot and cold choices. The staff will also cook your eggs to order. The suites have two rooms so the kids can watch t.v. in one room and the adults can sit and talk or watch t.v. in the other room. The hotel and rooms are impeccibly clean and the staff are super helpful and nice. The front desk also sells tickets to the theme parks. The gift shop offers a wonderful selection of Disney character items that are considerbly less than what you will pay at a gift shop inside Disney World. They also offer snacks and microwaveable entrees that you can cook in your room. The restaurants are excellent. Additionally, there is a pizza restaurant and a drug store across the street. I just love this hotel. It is extremely well priced for all the ammenities it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room for the Price, But Location Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: chels726
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Dec. 31, 2010-Jan. 4, 2011. The weather was beautiful, and we were hoping for a good vacation. In some ways, the Buena Vista Suites met our expectations, and in other ways, it did not. Rooms-- The suites are very clean and spacious. We had no problems with housekeeping (as other reviewers have), and we had more than enough room for us and some friends who visited for a couple days. We especially liked the microwave and decently-sized refrigeration that came in the suite. Pool/Hot Tub-- While we were there, we had the pool/hot tub area almost completely to ourselves. No need to compete for a chair. The pool wasn't that large, but with no one really using it, it was perfectly sized for us. The hot tub, on the other hand, was more like a bath tub. The water was hot, but the jets would not work. I complained to management the first two days, and gave up after that. Free Breakfast-- The breakfast here was decent, but not as expansive as I've seen at places like Embassy Suites. Everyday, there were breakfast potatoes, french toast or pancakes, bacon, scrambled eggs, grits, mini doughnuts, sliced oranges, canned fruit, dry cereal, and a large bowl of yogurt. I was hoping for some other, slightly healthier options, like oatmeal, more fruit, or different varieties of yogurt (like I've seen at Embassy Suites). Either way, it got the job done for breakfast. Location-- This is the one aspect that I really disliked about the hotel. The hotel is located on the intersection of two busy highways. You virtually cannot walk anywhere, except for the Caribe Royale next door. There is a CVS, a pizza place, and a take-out Asian food place across one of the highways, but there are no pedestrian paths to get you there. You basically have to wait for traffic to slow down and J-walk. Free shuttle services to the Disney parks is nice, but if you want to go to Downtown Disney, your only option is to go in the evening. Taking a cab ride or shuttle over to the Downtown Disney area will run you about $15-18 one way. There are no free shuttle services to the airport, so a cab ride will cost you about $40-45 one way while a shuttle is $21 per person. There are also no free shuttle services to SeaWorld or the Universal Parks, so you are looking at shuttle prices of about $18-23 per person. Food-- For some reason, it does not appear that you are supposed to order outside food to this hotel. When we checked in, we were told to ignore any pizza flyers. We did order room service one night (food was fine, but a little pricey), and tried to order Dominos pizza another night. We ordered the Dominos pizza online, and when the pizza guy finally got to the hotel, he said something like "Did you order online? We aren't supposed to deliver here, so I got confused with which hotel it was." From then on, we made sure we were in a location that we could eat both lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “3 C's for leisure and business travelers”
Reviews.Author: biyahetayo
Reviews.Content: Why 3 C's? Convenience, Comfort and Cleanliness My family (4) and family friends (5) came to Orlando for a brief vacation in a last minute decision. Looking for a decent hotels/suites I researched thru internet, this impressed me the most for the affordability and the 3 C's I consider when vacationing. Convenience: Walking distance across this hotel are CVS, 7-Eleven, gas station, pizzas and restaurants. The hotel is only a few miles to Disney, Sea World, Universal Studio and shopping to Orlando Premium Factory Outlet is pretty close. In and out to I-4 highway is somewhere a mile (at exit 68). If you want a fine restaurant, Caribe Royale Hotel of Orlando is right at the back of your suite (walking distance) with 3 finest restaurants you can find in Orlando. Comfort: Bedroom and living room are spacious. With two full size bed in your bedroom and a separate living room with wider sofa bed/sleeper, you can fit a total of 6 adults in your suite. Both rooms have 42" Flat Screen TV's and plenty of huge drawers where you can store all your stuff. The living room has a dining or office table with internet access, chairs, microwave, refrigerator and coffee dispenser. A privacy door between the bedroom and living room gave us the best comfort when my children were watching tv/movies and playing video games with their friends anytime. Cleanliness: A very busy suite/hotel yet they maintain the high standard of cleanliness and hospitality. The rooms are well-maintained, no bad odor, spotless linens and towels. During our daily free breakfast I noticed the employees are professionally and presentably dressed, quick food replenishment, they worked harmoniously and very polite. With so many people coming in and out during breakfast, the dining tables, chairs and floors are amazingly clean at all times, My children couldn't refrain from giving constant tips every time we had breakfast, employees deserved this extra reward from us. My family and friends admire the hard work of these employees, they are the facade of this business. I talked to some visitors in that hotel, their only complain was the key card entry to the their room. Just like what I experienced on my first day, I have to go back and forth twice to the receptionist to rectify the key problem. Technical personnel fixed it instantly. This doesn't prevent me from giving the best review in my opinion. Over-all experience is 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms/good value”
Reviews.Author: paradelover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec. 11th & this was our second visit at this hotel. We like that it isn't a huge hotel & is convenient to Disney entrance. The best part though is the guest rooms--they are very nice with updated & clean decor, nice dresser in room with about 8 drawers. Upon entering you are in the living room with a large screen TV, microwave & frig--all nicely disguised. Adjoining that is the bedroom which places it further from the corridor & therefore you don't hear anything. The best part for us though is the high quality mattress, plush but firm--very comfortable. The breakfast (free) is very good & we like that they have eggs & toast if you prefer a hot meal. The other 5 days of our stay was at Disney's Beach Club Villas (over 3 times the cost!) & our room there wasn't nearly as nice as BVSuites. If you don't mind staying outside the Disney Park, you couldn't find a better hotel than Buena Vista Suites.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: brezmar123
Reviews.Content: this was a beautiful yet small and quiet hotel. The rooms were large and very clean and comfortable. The beds were very nice. Plenty of towels and the room was cleaned nice in early in the day. The employees at the front desk were more then helpful when I need to anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great family value.”
Reviews.Author: Kurtdis
Reviews.Content: We have 4 kids which would require us to get two rooms at most hotels. Since this is a suite we can fit all six of us. With a free breakfast, it is really a great value. Rooms are clean and newly remodeled. We always enjoy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, but some minor problems that they need to work on!”
Reviews.Author: redsoxlovr-7
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was an excellent choice, however there were some minor problems I think that the Management needs to work on. My boyfriend and I stayed for 9 nights. The Staff was the most friendliest I have ever dealt with! We were greeted with a smile and "How are you" every time we walked in the door! The rooms were nice and large enough for the 2 of us! The king bed we had was very comfortable! I checked for bedbugs as I know this is a growing problem and did not find any! I am a Health Inspector by profession so this was very important to me. The small refrigerator and microwave in our room was a great convenience. We had a problem when we used the dryers in the 4th floor laundry room as they did not work and we spent the money to use them but the staff was very accomadating when I went to them with the problem. They had the housekeeper dry our clothes and then brought them up to our room. The Shuttle service to the parks was great not a small van but a bus that was very comfortable! The only other problem we encountered was that the food for the breakfast buffet was lukewarm at best and again this was important because of what I do for a living so after 4 days of this we decided to eat elsewhere! We had the free breakfast included with our stay so we were dissappointed that this was a problem. The Management really needs to do something about this and I hope they do if they read this review. The housekeeping staff was great! We had a small problem with our safe in our room but it was fixed within 10 minutes! Overall this Hotel is a great value and I would recommend it to anyone but I would think about getting the free breakfast if it is something you would like to have included with your stay here! The only other thing I was dissappointed with was the charge of $8.99 for the high speed internet service. Most Hotels will include this at no charge or provide free wi-fi. I did not bring my computer with me on my trip because of this! My boyfriend and I would consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: wdc1132
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Buena Vista Suites before and enjoyed it. We had friends come in from out of state and they booked a room across from us. They were impressed with everything about the suites especially the low price for what we received. Employees are friendly and it is a straight drive into Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: snoopy4141
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Buena Vista Suites. Our rate was very reasonable and we were happy with the size of our room. We were greeted courtesy, efficiency and given complimentary cookies and bottles of water when we went back to the room at night. We enjoyed the free breakfast and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Best night's sleep I've ever had while traveling!”
Reviews.Author: DEvans15
Reviews.Content: I visit Walt Disney World parks several times a year and always stay onsite. Now I'm questioning exactly why I did that! This place was wonderful. The rooms were spacious and beautifully decorated with the most comfortable bed I've ever had while traveling. The full breakfast buffet each morning added to the value as well and was much, much better than I had anticipated. The staff was friendly and helpful. I looked at the schedule for their complimentary Mears bus shuttle to the parks and it looked to be very accommodating. I didn't use it, but I rarely used Disney's onsite transportation system either. Travel time to any park was less than 15 minutes. Price comparable to a Disney value resort with amenities closer to Disney deluxe accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunsetnyca
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Buena Vista Suites. The room was clean and spacious. We love the Holiday decorations and especially the beautiful gingerbread hotel. The breakfast was perfect for us and there was plenty of it. My daughter even wrote a thank you note to the hotel staff for being so nice to her. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends and family!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Who knew the rooms would be that nice from the outside??”
Reviews.Author: Shea1982
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that we have ever tried this hotel. I was just expecting a basic hotel room. The outside of the building is very plain and nothing exciting. The lobby is nice. We got a Deluxe King Suite and were pleasantly surprised by it! Two large flat screens, a VERY comfortable bed, and bathroom with a jetted tub, and just overall nice furnishings. For about $100 a night, I wasn't expecting this! The fact that it comes with a free breakfast buffet is an added benefit. I really don't know why people bash the buffet, which is FREE. My only wish is that they would have fresh fruit and not the tropical fruit salad. But everything else was hot and continuously being refreshed. Two things about the room that I didn't like were that the toilet was behind the bathroom door in an awkward position and the flip lock on the hotel room door was very low. We had our 4 year old with us and she would have EASILY been able to open the door had someone come knocking in the middle of the night. We solved this by taking the SUPER heavy coffee table and placing it in front of the door. (Might have been a fire hazard but I was willing to take that risk.) We didn't use the pool, room service, or the park shuttle. The hotel has free parking which is always a good thing. I am sure we will be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and close to parks”
Reviews.Author: kevinrmclean
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Booked using mousesaver.com code. Very good service. Hotel is showing a little wear from the latest renovation. I sell pest control chemicals and have taken many classes on bedbugs. I did a quick inspection when we arrived and our room was spotless. The breakfast was good. Not great, but good. Plenty of food, but some was overcooked, and over seasoned. Would expect Florida would have good orange juice. This was not so good. We had vouchers for free drinks from the bar and they were great. Not pushy to buy extras. All in all a great stay. Will definitely be back when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Only slightly above average”
Reviews.Author: TLatif929
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buena Vista Suites for our family trip to WDW. The pros: GREAT location, the entrance to the park is literally up the street - less than a mile from the hotel. The complimentary breakfast buffet was what you'd expect, decent quality but not much variety. Service at breakfast was very good - staff is very accommodating. The room was very nice, a suite with a separate bedroom, which is a must for families with kids. The cons: the pool was filthy, there was a scum line that ran around the entire pool. Mid-way through our stay, a loud soccer team moved in to the rooms across the hall from us. At 10pm, the kids were stampeding up and down the hallways, yelling and shrieking. After 30 minutes, we called the front desk manager, who immediately approached the "coach" of the group - an idiot who simply threw up his hands and basically refused to do anything to control his group. The manager apologized to us profusely and gave us a credit voucher, however, after an hour of non-stop noise, which woke up our sleeping child, we had enough and asked to be moved, which we were. We will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alexa020
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure staying in this hotel. The rooms are huge suites with everything you possibly need. Clean, clean, clean. The staff is right on spot when you need something. The hotel restaurant is great also. Good food for a great price. My husband and I will definitely return to this hotel next summer with our granddaughter. Thanks for taking care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Cynthiag01
Reviews.Content: This hotel met my expectations for the money paid. The location can't be beat, the breakfast that is included in the price was a real time saver and had a decent selection of food/drink. I appreciated the gift shop for last minute needs, they had a nice selection of everything. The front desk personnel were great. There is nothing negative I can say about my recent stay. We stayed 4 nights and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations, great value”
Reviews.Author: chaosmgr
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The location was perfect. The room was clean and comfortable. The beds were waaaay better than any I can remember except for a recent trip to Paris. They were cozy and inviting after a long day on your feet. It was quiet; the staff was friendly, helpful and attentive. I would recommend it to any and all who are seeking a hotel that is more than just a bedroom. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay on a Tight Budget”
Reviews.Author: damocles1
Reviews.Content: Normally, we stay on WDW property, but when I decided to make a spur of the moment, budget-conscious car trip with the kids, I chose the Buena Vista Suites because of a special I had seen advertised. I have to say, our stay there was pretty nice. At check-in, we did have a problem with our room key/door lock malfunctioning which held us up for quite a while, but the matter was resolved by the management to our satisfaction. The rooms were spacious and most of all, clean---really, the most important quality to me! Our family enjoyed the complimentary breakfast buffet every morning before heading to the parks and we found the dining room staff to be so friendly and helpful! (I don't understand other's complaints about this buffet. There were a variety of foods and it all tasted great. The coffee here was WAY better than the deplorable stuff they serve on WDW property. Best of all, this buffet was *free*.) We had our own vehicle, so we didn't use the shuttle service. The pool was nothing special, but our 3 kids (ages 10, 8, & 4) did enjoy going for a swim on our park-free day. The drive to/from the parks didn't seem to take very long---10-15 minutes. While I did seem to miss the "magic" of staying on WDW property, this hotel was perfect for us on this particular trip and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if we didn't have a need for the Magical Express shuttle service from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just a night out with the kids”
Reviews.Author: tampa2211
Reviews.Content: Im a loyal guest at the caribe royale so i figured that i would try out their sister hotel and stay at the buena vista. The suite we stayed in was very nice, clean, and comfortable. I slept like a baby on their bed. The kids were able to play in the living room area and watch tv while the adults were in the main bedroom watching sports and hanging out. It was just a nice relaxing fun night with the fam. Breakfast was good too. my daughter loved the pancakes and i was a fan of the cream of wheat. :)

Reviews.Title: “very roomy,relaxing and close to disney”
Reviews.Author: meg1_10
Reviews.Content: we stayed on disney property for the beginning of our stay and finished out with the last 3 days at the beuna vista. It was very relaxing and the beds were some of the most comfortable we have experienced. We were very pleased with our stay. We had one more day to use on our park passes so we took the buena vista shuttle and we were there in no time although the trip back on the shuttle did take about 45 minutes because it had to go 2 of the other parks. Fortunately the shuttle was comfortable and had movie screens to watch. If we stayed again and were planning to see the sights for many of the days, we would rent a car. Our 4 and 5 year old were able to sleep in one room and we were able to stay up a bit longer in the other part of the suite. Also the breakfast was satisfying. All and all a very good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Awfull staff”
Reviews.Author: win76
Reviews.Content: The staff at the frontdesk was terrible. Staff at the frontdesk was not interested at all, rude and not helpfull to say the least. They didnt greet us when we arrived and didnt even look at us if when we asked for information. Worst staff i have ever seen. Same thing happened when we checked out. Breakfast was poor, not much to choose from. I would expect more from a 3-4 star hotel Swimming pool was closed during our stay and all equipment in the fitness room, except one were out of order. My advise: stay away from this hotel! there are more nicer and better hotels on International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: savi_75
Reviews.Content: Locationwiseok; close to disney parks.while returning to the hotel the bus driver left us waiting for more then 1 1/2 hour without any explanation nor apology so finally we walked back to the hotel. room was clean, bathroom out-dated. staff at frontdesk was not interested and at chek-out rude. breakfast was poorly and unhealthy. all equipment in exercise room was broken and the pool was not in use. overall had we known all this before checking in then we would have chosen for another hotel. We read the comments on tripadvisor after booking and thought we had booked a good hotel but that was not the case. we dont recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jesus_girl2010
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. We arrived on the 16th and stayed until the 19th. It was very quiet, clean and the staff was awesome. The beds are so soft that i slept like a baby. Full breakfast such as, grits, eggs sausage, french toast bacon and much much more. The suit is right down the road from disney. The staff was very perfessional and friendly. This was my first trip to florida and they really made my stay a memorable one. We are difinately return. We are planning another trip in June and this will be the hotel we will stay at. Don't listen to the bad reviews. Some people are just picky. This place is awesome. Words can not express. One word of advise though.... Don't drink the water in the bottles in the room are you will be charged 4 dollars per bottle.lol

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: margaracaballero
Reviews.Content: I have stayed before at the Buena Vista Suites Hotel and I keep coming back. It is a very good value for the money. The hotel has an excellent location, rooms are very clean, beds are very comfortable, and you get a mini-suite for the price of a hotel room. The mini refrigerator and microwave are a plus. Their full american breakfast is great, you have many items to choose from. Even though we did not use the shuttle busses, they are also very convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small suites”
Reviews.Author: matts8008
Reviews.Content: The Buena Vista Suites is a nice hotel in a great location. Only about 10 minutes from the Disney parks and right across the street from a 7-11nnd CVS as well as Chinese and PIzza restaurants. The staff was friendly and the room was very clean. We travel to Orlando often and always try to book a suite or condo instead of a standard hotel room, but the suites here were tiny! Very narrow and not much space. There were two large flat panel TVs with full HD programming which was a nice change from the usual low TV quality in most hotels. Free WiFi was nice as well, even though it was difficult to use and required signing in each time you wanted to use it. The breakfast was nice to have, but low quality and not much selection. Overall this is a good option if you need a suite for 1-2 nights. Any longer and the small rooms begin to feel cramped, especially when there are many other suites in the area that offer larger rooms and even kitchens for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought BUT I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: EMM119
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel thinking we would use the shuttle to and from the disney properties. Not happening. The shuttles ran on a schedule. Going was not a problem. Coming back was. We ended up renting a car which wasn't bad considering we were considered being there during the "off" season, so cost was not bad. The hotel was very nice, the room was nice. Wasn't thrilled with the cleaning staff but have to comment on the rest of the service of the hotel. No matter what we called for the staff was there within 15 minutes with whatever concern we called for. No problem with anyone at the front desk, they were very very helpful. The buffet breakfast...well not much to talk about but it was free...after the 2nd day, you are bored with it...but it's free. If you stay, rent a car. Disney and most other properties are within 10 miles or so. Down size of renting a car is the cost of paying when you get to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay to save money on a Disney trip - but could not get wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: DalePortland
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here to save some money on our Disney trip - and was mostly happy with our decision. The price was very good for a suite room. We took advantage of the nice free breakfast in the morning and the shuttle service to Disney was good. However, the pool was small and we were never able to get the wireless internet service to work.

Reviews.Title: “I Got to be My Own Housekeeper!”
Reviews.Author: shaybow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Buena Vista Suites 8/7 - 8/12 Upon our arrival on 8/7, our room was ready for check in, but, aparently there are no bell services (or even bell carts to use) on weekend arrivals. I inquired at the front desk about getting a cart since we had cases of water & other heavy items and they paged housekeeping to bring one. 45 minutes (and several inquiries) later, I gave up and carried everything to our room without the cart. When we arrived in our room, one of the first things you notice is the security deadbolt that was dangling broken from the door. My father (being the type of person he is) used his swiss army knive and put the lock back on the door. The other thing I noticed were the long back hairs on the bathroom floor, in the bathtub and around the toilet. I know that people aren't perfect so we swept them up with a towel. One of the perks of choosing this hotel was the free breakfast buffet that is offered. I guarantee that I have learned from this lesson and will never even consider that a reason for choosing a hotel in the future. The free breakfast in the morning was less than appetizing. Every day that we attempted to eat downstairs the scrambled eggs were so undercooked that it looked like they were in a cheese sauce. One of the days there was some sort of ham with pineapples swimming in grease. Of the 6 nights that we stayed at the hotel we had to do our own housekeeping chores 4 of those nights. The only reason that housekeeping was done on 2 of the days is because I specifically told the front desk that we needed it cleaned at 8:30 in the morning. There were 3 days that we arrived back at the hotel after 4:30 and housekeeping still had not shown up. Then it was a hassel to track down a housekeeper, exchange our towels & coffee cups and even take out our own trash. The only time we went out to use the pool, the music on the outdoor speakers were so loud that you couldn't have a conversation. Complaining to the front desk only prompted them to turn the music up louder. When I go on vacation, I don't expect everything to be absolutely perfect, but with the amount of hotel competition in the Orlando area you expect hotels to go above & beyond. I certainly do not expect to have to clean my own room and be a housekeeper (I do that enough when I'm not on vacation).

Reviews.Title: “OMG! No regrets. We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: dimples20034life
Reviews.Content: Before I begin with my details I must say that some people on here really over-react about their reviews on this site. I mean some of them will scare the crap out of you if you let them. A word to the wise, if a hotel has a lot of bad reviews-runnnnnnnnnnnnnn like a bat out of hell but if there are like only a few bad reviews because you know some people complain about everything, take a risk. You never know... My husband, 9 year and 2 year old and I stayed at this lovely hotel. I had gotten a good deal on 1-800-hotels but they went bankrupt and my reservations were cancelled with the hotel because of non-payment on 1-800-hotels behalf. Unfortunatley, I did not discover this until arriving at the hotel. However, there was this wonderful Chinese looking guy who really helped us and he offered to let us stay at the hotel for the same rate we were given by 1-800-hotels. We had a beautiful stay. The rooms were beautifully decorated. The beds were beyond comfy and OMG the televisions were just marvelous. I swear, my hubby and I fell asleep in a matter of minutes because the beds were so comfy in front of the big screen t.v in the room. They offer great movie chanels as well. More than the average hotel, I'd say. The hotel provided breakfast everymorning which was good. Trust me, this is one hotel that you won't regret staying at.

Reviews.Title: “overall great exprience”
Reviews.Author: shawnkiki
Reviews.Content: Great location for traveling to disney parks. Walmart near by to save on snacks and water for the hotel. Beds were very comfortable. Free breakfast was a saver,go early as it gets very busy. Pool area could be better, but it was ok for how much we used it. I would recommend this hotel as you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel, great location with breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Canadianmom1
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at this hotel and found it to be central to our Disney/Universal holiday. The hotel staff were very friendly and worked very hard to make our stay an enjoyable one. Parking was free. There is a shuttle that takes you to and from the Disney parks but we chose to rent a car and drive ourselves to avoid the crowds and come and go when we wanted. In the lobby, there is a "ticket" desk which is really a time share rep in disguise. We did agree to get our tickets from them and saved a fair amount of money. It cost us a few hours early on Sunday at a time share presentation. BVS included a hot breakfast for free every morning. There was a fruit/yogurt/cereal bar, a hot buffet of pancakes, scrambled eggs, ham/bacon, oatmeal/cream of wheat. A cook on duty was able to make fried eggs and toast/bagel to order. The restaurant was extremely busy from 9-10am but when we went earlier, it was quieter. Lots of tour groups seem to stay here so timing your breakfast before they arrive in the restaurant is helpful. The rooms were comfortable. Lots of space for a family of four. The cleanliness was OK...I would have liked to see a bit better job of vacuuming and some the bed linens were a bit worn but they were clean. The beds were new, high top and comfy. The down comforter was nice. One child slept on the pull out couch which was a bit lumpy. Two large flat screen TV's helped to keep the peace between our kids. The fridge/microwave allowed us to do some shopping at the nearby Wal-mart and stock up on snack foods,drinks and lunch items which helped to cut our costs for food (which can be considerable at the Disney parks). There was LOTs of storage spacke for clothes in the big dressers. It would have been nice to have a few more hangers in the closets and hooks in the bathrooms. The sink outside of the bathtub/toilet room made getting ready in the morning easier for everyone. I did use the laundry room and it could use some work. It was a bit dirty, the machines were run down (two dryers were out of order) and having to buy the laundry soap down the hall in the gift shop was a pain (I brought my own). The hotel was generally quiet except when guests were returning from the parks late at night and thought it was OK to yell down the halls. However, the rooms near the main road were insulated well enough not to hear the traffic. The kids used the pool once but it wasn't necessary with the Disney waterparks so close. Overall, this is a reasonable 3 star hotel, convenient to everything and reasonably priced. We would recommend this place to others and stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations, affordable”
Reviews.Author: freepass
Reviews.Content: traveled with my three grandchildren ages 5-9. I was a little worried about what to expect, however, the hotel exceeded my expectations. The morning breakfast was ok, not top of the line, but not bottom of the barrel. You can have your eggs cooked the way you want them. There was a variety of food available. The rooms were clean and modern. The hotel staff was very friendly. The schedule for the shuttle was good. My sisters stayed at a resort and their shuttle did not make as many trips to/from the parks. There was also a shuttle to take visiors to the shopping plaza. I would definitely stay at the hotel again. Reserved the room online and received a very good rate. This hotel was excellent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: ngachick
Reviews.Content: We frequent the Orlando area every year and this was our first stay at the Buena Vista Suites. Overall I was pleased with the stay. The beds are very comfortable and it was nice, with children in tow, to have two large flat screen televisions in the room. The room was very spacious and also had a microwave and refridgerator. Staff was friendly and very prompt to respond to requests for towels, etc. Free breakfast was very nice. Selections every morning included eggs, potatoes, grits, oatmeal, a meat, a fruit, yogurt and dry cereals. Large variety of drinks included the typical breakfast selections as well as sodas. Also to be had each morning was either pancakes or french toast. Meat selections were either link sausage, bacon or ham. (Only one kind each morning). There were also small donuts available. You could also have made to order omlets. The only things that could have made it better would have been gravy and biscuits and/or toast. My mom and her friend who travelled with us ate lunch in the hotel restaurant and ordered burgers. Mom reported it was one of the best burgers she ever ate. The hot tub did not work one night but it was working later in the week. If you are travelling with a group of 5 or more, and some of you are required to sleep on the fold out sofa, note that you will hear every sound made in the hall. The doors to the rooms do not close easily....they slam and some folks don't seem to realize how far the sound of slamming doors and their voices carry. I slept in both the bedroom and on the sofa different nights during the trip. As long as you are in the bedroom you will hardly hear any noise. I did fill out a comment card suggesting that signs requesting that guests observe a quiet time between 11 pm and 7 am be posted. I think that might help the sofa sleepers. Shuttle service to Disney offered. My mom and her friend decided to visit Animal Kingdom one day and went out to meet the last bus returning to the hotel for the day and there was no room for them. They were told to call the hotel and request another bus. When one didn't arrive they eventually caught a cab. Upon returning to the hotel they went to the desk and explained what happened and were promptly refunded their cab fees. Very good, acceptable resolution to the complaint. We had need for internet and it posted a charge of 8.99 per day for wi-fi, we agreed to pay the charges and got access, however, the charges did not appear on the final bill. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good, low cost lodging option when visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Ellis Family Reunion -July 2nd-5th”
Reviews.Author: Lexington_NCAnn
Reviews.Content: We arrived several hours early for our stay at this hotel. To my surprise, 98% of our room block was ready and we were able to check in then. They rooms were very clean and looked as indicated on the website. Beds were very comfortable--I have a bad back and most hotel beds are either too hard or too soft. Staff was very friendly and accommodating-no problems at all. Free full breakfast was okay. The pool and hot tub was on the small side, but the children were able to enjoy the much bigger pool and water slide at Buena Vista's sister hotel next door-which they thoroughly enjoyed. They also had a tennis and basketball court-which some of the family used during our stay. The hotel is in a good location and near the major theme parks--Disney was just a couple of miles away. The hotel offered free shuttle service at scheduled times or you could pay to be transported.--cost was about 3.00 per person using the van services. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and would use the hotel again. The rate we paid was very good for this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lysaeli
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Disneyworld and we really enjoyed our stay at Buena Vista Suites. The hotel exterior looks pretty plain. Front desk clerk was friendly and efficient during checkin and checkout. We were surprised at how spacious the room was and liked the modern look of the furniture. Yes, our daughters enjoyed jumping on the beds and were thrilled that there were two televisions available (although we only used the one in the living room). We did not have any problems with noise. The ice machine on our floor was out of service but ice was only a floor away. Breakfast buffet was delicious although my daughters got tired of the main dish selections (atleast one rotation was noted). The line gets a little packed but mainly because few people notice the buffet is also on the other side. Hotel offers shuttle service which was great and the drivers are very informative (giving out tips and history) and entertaining (a song or two). The bus is very comfortable compared to the Disney Resort transportation but make sure you are out there in time. We had a chance to visit the pool once and it was nice (towels available as you enter). CVS across the street-good place to buy water/gatorade and forgotten items. Room has a fridge so we stored drinks there for the park visits. Pizza place next to CVS is very tasty and affordable (picked up for dinner twice). Short drive to other restaurants like Golden Corral, McDonald's, etc. plus the outlets. Overall, a great visit!!! We will definately stay here on our next trip or might even try the sister hotel Caribe Royal. Big thanks to those who posted reviews; I made our hotel choice based on Tripadvisor reviews and am really glad I did. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Buena Vista Suites”
Reviews.Author: soonergirl23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Buena Vista Suites in late May 2010 for 6 nights. The room was very nice and clean. It consisted of a bedroom, a living room, and a bathroom. The hotel room had a flat screen television in the bedroom and a flat screen television in the living area. My husband really liked this feature of the suite. The sofa in the living area folded out into a bed, which was fairly comfortable. The beds in the bedroom were very comfortable. The staff at this hotel was very good. Check-in was quick and simple. In the lobby, there is a concierge that was always very helpful with all sorts of things. The staff also brought pillows and towels promptly without any problem. The shuttle was pretty convenient. There were a variety times that the shuttle left the hotel and picked up at the various resorts. You just had to keep a schedule of the shuttle with you and get used to how the shuttle ran. For the most part, the bus drivers on the shuttle buses were very friendly, especially the female bus driver in the morning. She was very friendly and very informative. (I cannot remember her name.) The daily breakfast buffet was fine (but not fabulous). They had eggs, bagels, donuts, potatoes, pancakes, yogurt, cereal, milk, orange juice, soda, and coffee. They alternated bacon, ham, and sausage every third day. It was not the best free continental breakfast that we have eaten. It was okay. Our family has had better. We have stayed at a Disney Resort on a previous vacation. What was great about staying at the Buena Vista Suites, instead of at a Disney Resort, is that you are not stuck giving all your money to The Mouse. We ate a Universal Studios one night and at Landry's Seafood and Steak House another night. There is also an outlet mall and a Wal-Mart very close to the hotel. The Wal-Mart has lots of Disney stuff that is a lot cheaper than at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Staying offsite can be enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: angipoo
Reviews.Content: Have been to Disney 7 times - first time staying offsite. BVS gave us plenty of room and a good breakfast every morning at an affordable rate. Staff was very friendly, rooms were clean and spacious and location was comparable to staying at some onsite properties. We stayed on the top floor (7th) and we were never disturbed during our 9 nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel for our Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: blackwell_76531
Reviews.Content: We came to Orlando for our Disney family vacation, the hotel was just what we wanted for our family of 10. We got 2 suites and they were very nice. We did have issues with the air conditioner in one of the rooms, but we were moved to a new room and had no problems and they gave us free internet for our stay. The free breakfast was great, we all got full before we headed to the parks. It was wonderful to have the parks just down the road. We did use the shuttle service on the first day, which was nice, but chose to use our own cars for the others. If we ever get to make this trip again, we would stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: cyberspy66
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 7 nights at BVS for our Disney vacation. The location is suburb. Its 5 minutes to the Disney Gates! The room was fantastic (updated / 2 LCD TVâ€™s). Everything was clean and the staff was super friendly. The breakfast each morning was perfect. There is a drug store across the street and Wal-Mart 5 mins away for last minute items. For the price and quality I highly recommend BVS! A car is recommended! We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a budget suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrwgagain
Reviews.Content: My two daughters (8 and 18), and the older daughters boyfriend stayed at the BV suites June 7-11, 2010. The hotel was okay, but had a "creepy" factor about it. It just did not seem clean. We wanted a suite so the boyfriend could stay on the fold-out, and the girls and I could stay in the bedroom. The bedroom was small, but sufficient. The hotel advertised free shuttle to parks...sure, if you could follow their limited schedule. Thank goodness we had a car! The hotel is just a mile from the parks as the crow flies, but still takes 20 minutes or so to actually get there. The breakfast buffet was good, nothing special, although the staff was amazing picking up after people. The coffee was good, and the oatmeal was GREAT! The fruit was canned on the "fruit bar" - NOTHING FRESH- no bananas, apples etc. All canned fruit. I wish we would have stayed at a disney resort - just for the convenience factor. We have stayed at shades of green previously, and I should have booked that again! I would NOT stay here- just an ICK factor that I could not shake. I am surprised that they did not have bedbugs - seriously. The swimming pool was nasty, too!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for your Buck, Great location to DW.”
Reviews.Author: bb7711
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 5 night stay at BVS for our Disney vacation. The location to Disney was great and the rooms were fabulous. We've stayed in many high end resorts in the past and by rooms in comparison you won't get much better.We've also stayed at Disney's Resort hotels. The staff was great and the facility was clean. The breakfast each morning was enough to tie you over until dinner with a long day at Disney. My family and I would highly recommend BVS!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: kirstielou
Reviews.Content: This is my first review, prompted by a great 16 night stay at this hotel. Rooms were spacious and clean, beds were comfy and there were plenty of fresh towels. Breakfast was fine - it's free and sufficient to fill you up for the day ahead. Staff were exceptionally friendly and a big shout out goes to the egg/toast chef Hildemaro. I agree with other reviewers that if you want a Dennys style breakfast then this will probably not do it for you but it saves the time of going out for breakfast and it saves money especially for a family. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff and requests for extra coffee, towels etc were responded to promptly with a smile. We used the free bus to Disney and also drove it. The bus had several drop off and pick up times and was air-conditioned and clean. If you drive then the main gates to the Walt Disney World complex is about 5 minutes away with Magic Kingdom about another 10 minutes away. The pool is great for cooling down at the end of the day and towels are provided at poolside. We used room service a couple of times and found the food to be good, the service prompt and the price reasonable The daily internet charge is pricey but as I booked with Expedia I got free internet access. We didn't want to be in the heart of Kissimmee or International Drive so the location was perfect for us and combined with the great price for the facilities and the exceptionally friendly staff I really wouldn't look for anywhere else especially for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased, would consider staying again.”
Reviews.Author: TCB123
Reviews.Content: We stopped by here for short stay after getting into Orlando early. Stayed here until our reservations on Disney Property were ready. This was a nice place to stay. Room size was more than adequate - although a bit narrow - plenty of overall space. The buffet breakfast was great - especially having a cook prep eggs/toast/ etc to order. This was well worth the money, and actually for the space/breakfast a much better deal than some other places out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: mamabear723
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in quite a few hotels in Orlando and this was one of the best. The suite was great, updated, comfy beds, 2 tvs, fridge and microwave. We had 4 adults and 3 kids and had plenty of room. The service was great. The complimentary breakfast was one of the best. You are also close to attractions and outlet centers. Best value, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - Very Nice People - Very Clean - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Techman1
Reviews.Content: Well my family and I traveled from Michigan to Flordia to see Disney - I researched a lot of different hotels and finally setteled on this one as the best choice. As it turned out I was right - What a wonderful experience. The people were great and the service was out of this world. When we arrived we got checked into the room quickly - no hassle becasue we were early. We made a stop at the local Walmart to get some food and goodies for the room. That was great because the Walmart is very close to the hotel.( 2 miles ). We loaded the fridge with our items and then headed down to the pool. The pool is a bit on the small side, after reading other posts, I had learned that you could just head over to the pool at the sister hotel. It was wonderful - had a waterfall and water slide. After coming back to the room we noticed the fridge was not that cold. We called the front desk and reported the problem. In less then 5 minutes there was a knock at the door and we had two service men ready to fix the issue. They reset the fridge and advised us if it was not cold in an hour - to call again and they would replace it. As they said it turned out the reset worked and it was cold with in the hour. We had no issues with any time share sale people and were never talked to by any of them - so rest assured you will not be bothered by that sort of thing. The room was wonderful, we had a king room with the hot tub and really enjoyed it. We stayed four nites and enjoyed the hotel, pool and room. The free breakfast was GREAT - they make your eggs to order and you can get as much as you need to fill up. This was a great benefit for the teenagers we had along with us. The kids could eat to their fill before we headed out to Disney for the day. There are lots of restraunts near by and we ventured out a few times to eat out. We also ate food in our room that we had in the fridge. The microwave was very handy and we used it often to make food in the room. Location was wonderful - so close to the parks and shopping. Loved this Hotel and would stay again !! We paid about $500 for four nites - Great price - Great Location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location and service”
Reviews.Author: jnjskriloff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were able to take off to Disney without the kids for the first time (OMG!) but were looking fo a hotel that would be good to use in the future when have them. We loved our stay here, guest services were very accomodating, suite was very spacious and clean, love it most because separate bedroom area from living space area. Then before taking off to the park in the am we were provided a compimentary hot breakfast. Ok, so the hotel didn't pull out all the stops on it, but food and beverages provided had a wide variety from hot eggs and pancakes to fresh fruit and cereal. Definitely plan on staying here in the future and recommending to others!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value near Disney”
Reviews.Author: MarcRoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buena vista suites for a week and the hotel is a great value when staying near Disney. The rooms are spacious, clean and include 2 flat screen tv! Plenty of free parking and free shuttle for Disney! Location is within minutes of Disney and Intl Drive main boulevard by car as well. Plenty of golfing around too. The free breakfast is ok though not fantastic. Overall, really good stay for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Hatshepsutt
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night, but the room was very nice and updated with ample room and nice amenites. The free full breakfast was hot and good and they had many food choices. This place was great for the price and location to Disney, I will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value At Buena Vista Suites!”
Reviews.Author: peedeejones
Reviews.Content: What can I say other than for a very special deal they had going where I got the 1 bedroom suite for only $80 per night, I feel that I got a steal! Everything was clean and comfortable. The morning breakfast was perfect for us. We had rented a car and it was a quick and easy drive to the outlet mall to shop and then to the grocery store to pick up bottled water, coffee and soda. CVS and 7/11 is directly across the street. The only issue I encountered was that most of the clothes dryers in the first floor laundry room were broken. We notified the front desk and they quickly sent someone to get a dryer in working order for us. I will absolutely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort at Buena Vista Suites”
Reviews.Author: ak0801
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonably-priced hotel suite in close proximity to Disney World and selected Buena Vista Suites. We were very pleased with our choice. The room layout was perfect for our family of four. A door separated a bedroom with 2 queen beds and a small living room which allowed the kids to maintain their early bedtimes without being disturbed by the grownups. The excellent price we found on mousesavers.com ($89/night) included a full breakfast each morning (which was served early so we could arrive at the Disney parks on time), and free parking. The hallways were a bit loud at night but the living room was a good buffer for the bedroom. The condition of the rooms was fine with the exception of a broken faucet handle the day we arrived (it was repaired the day we notified the front desk) and a lack of detail cleaning (there was an old pacifier on the floor by the bed). We used the coin laundry that was conveniently available and operable on two floors and the kids enjoyed the outdoor pool. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for Price”
Reviews.Author: ArtemisJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean both outside and inside. There is a small smoking area off to one side in front of the building and most people put their cigarette butts in the trash but a few slobs left some butts on the ground. The room was clean although the carpet and arm chair in the bedroom have seen better days. The beds were comfortable and the lights in both the bedroom and living area were adequate. The in room safe is a good size so you can actually store stuff in it. The refrigerator and microwave are in the living area and there are drawers where you can store snacks. The freezer did not freeze the water placed in it but maybe the thermostat was down too low. The hotel has a mini store where you can purchase beverages and microwaveable stuff (the store does not sell books). There is a CVS and a 7-11 directly across the street but the street is actually the highway and I did not see crosswalks. I did cross the highway on two separate occasions. There are two coin operated laundry facilities on the property. One is located on the first floor and the other is on the 4th floor. It costs 1.25 to wash and 1.25 to dry a load. The mini store does sell laundry detergent and dryer sheets. The breakfast buffet consisted of scrambled eggs, potatoes, grits and oatmeal. The breakfast meats rotated daily with ham, bacon and sausage. Pancakes and french toast sticks also rotated daily. Fried eggs are available as well as toasted bagels and toast. In addition, there are mini donuts, yogurt (served in a huge bowl), cold cereal and oranges. I think one day there was canned pears but the only fresh fruit available everyday was oranges. The coffee was not too bad. You are not supposed to remove food from the breakfast serving area but you can take your coffee as there are paper cups for the beverages. Overall, the breakfast was adequate. I did eat at the restaurant one evening since they hotel gave a voucher for 15% off. Again, the food was just ok. I had French onion soup, a ceasar salad with grilled chicken and soda. With tax, tip and discount the bill was $21.07. The hotel does offer a free shuttle service to Disney parks but there is limited shuttle service. There are only two morning and two afternoon departures to the parks and two returns in the evening. When the park is open later than usual, there is generally an extra pick up after the parking closing. However, you are advised to give yourself 30 minutes to get back to the bus if you are in Magic Kingdom so you will not be able to hear the music that accompanies the fireworks but you can still see the fireworks from the parking lot. In addition, there is only one return from Downtown disney and that is at 11:20 p.m. I had arrived at the hotel and planned on spending the afternoon having lunch at Beaches and Cream and then head to Downtown Disney but I missed the first afternoon departure and the second was scheduled for 4:00. The hotel called a cab but in actuality they called a car service and it cost $21.00 to go from the hotel to Disney Boardwalk hotel. I returned to the hotel by taking Disney transportation to Hollywood Studios to catch the evening shuttle back to the hotel. I prearranged transportation to Sea World with Mears but learned that there is a public bus that you can catch at the ticket and transportation center in Disney and it costs $2. I don't know how late the bus runs but I did see the bus at night when returning from the Magic Kingdom. My hotel rate was from a one day sale so I got a decent rate for my four night stay. Overall, the hotel was comfortable and adequate for the price that I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: LesleyG333
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, 3 adults and 2 children 13, and 10. booked 2 rooms, 1 double and 1 king. Staff was great and gave us an adjoining room. Rooms were very clean, spacious and looked just like the pictures. Was great having the 2 flat screen TV's. kids loved that. beds were very comfortable and was nice to come back to after a day at the parks! lots of pillows, etc. Hotel pool is nice, and not very crowded (at least when we were there) there was a small arcade that the kids enjoyed, and a small store that stocked lots of items if needed. the hotel is in a great location, was so close to the Disney parks, Walmart, Lake Buena Vista Factory Outlet, and Premium Outlet. Good thing to stock up on bottled water and snacks at Walmart. rooms have fridges and microwaves. the free breakfast was a HUGE savings! nothing fancy but still good. they had scrambled eggs and made to order eggs every morning, either ham or sausages, french toast or pancakes, hot and cold cereals, mini doughnuts, made to order white or brown toast, or mini bagels, cut up oranges, fruit cocktail, and milk, coffee, tea, hot chocolate ,and juices. more than ample. Disney resorts cannot do it any better! we ate breakfast once at Ohana's. it was good but not worth the 22.50 per person! we got a great rate of 80.95 per night, on their website, (they have online deals Thursdays!) when comparing to any other hotel, you can't beat this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: cybergroove
Reviews.Content: Buena Vista Suites best features are the spacious king suites and the location. We had a King Suite (room 401) the floor plan was great; however, the room itself was just ok mostly because of small details. Things like the shower plate was not adhered to the shower, holes in sheets, thin sheets, rough towels, masking tape above the mirror that was not removed after painting, minor stuff yes, but worth mentioning. The spacious floor plan works great for a family of 3 or 4 looking for a place to unwind after long days in the amusement parks. The car was parked in any of the parks within 10 minutes of leaving the hotel (crowds were low; therefore, so was traffic). If you are looking for a comfortable place to rest after spending all day in the parks, this is a great place. If you are looking for a nice romantic get away, do not book this place. One more thing, I value a good breakfast, don't book this based on the free breakfast alone. We ate a McDonald's and elsewhere after our first taste of the buffet; however, it is free. Also since this place is the best bang for your buck especially for traveling families, expect allot of kids running around.

Reviews.Title: “Two teens, two rooms, free breakfast - Need I say more?”
Reviews.Author: JustOnlyMe
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our stay at Buena Vista Suites. The beds were very comfortable (and the sleep sofa was exactly as billed: a sleep sofa). Free breakfast was fantastic, hot, and plentiful. The hotel employees were very helpful and friendly. The housekeeping staff did an exceptional job daily. The location was very convenient to the parks, making the return in the evenings a pleasure. Thank you, Buena Vista Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great location!”
Reviews.Author: chykov
Reviews.Content: You could not beat this place for the price! great suite (2 flat screen tv's!). Clean and comfortable. We travelled with 3 young kids, 1, 4, 6. and it was very nice. The breakfast buffet was great and the kids loved the pool (when you can swim in January, who wouldn't). All for $89 bucks a night. And a 5 minute drive to Disney to boot! Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, basic hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Pennchic6
Reviews.Content: The rooms weren't very big, but adequate. Updated with granite countertops, etc, though still pretty basic. No soap dish at the sink was my biggest complaint. The mattresses were super soft as well. Decent breakfast buffet, though. Business center was just two computers which cost $5 just to use and ten or twenty cents per page to print from (prints to the front desk). In-room internet use was $9/day. Fitness center was small, but had a treadmill, elliptical and stairstepper plus a couple of pulley machines. No real space to stretch though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice size rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Pyramidtraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Downtown Disney, Hollywood Studios and an easy drive to the airport. We stayed here with our teenage sons and having the separate room worked well with some of us liking to stay up later than others in the family. The room had a microwave, refrigerator and nice size flat screen TV. The buffet breakfast was OK. It was nice to have a hot variety of food versus just bagels and cold cereal. A good way to start off the day of activities or travel. There were several bus loads of high school band members staying at the resort also, but very well behaved and we had no problems with noise even when they came into the hotel all at 1100PM. There is a Seven Eleven gas station/store right across the street. The pool area is adequate but if you are staying and want a big pool area, it isn't here. Overall it was a good place to stay with the extra room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Europeanone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous for the price. I am a seasoned traveller and would recommend it to all. I am typing this from my iPhone in the hotel room. I do wish the hotel offered free wifi but the accommodations are othwise impressive. I just called down for extra towels and housekeeping knocked on my door within 5 minutes. My only other complaint is the infrequency of the disney shuttle. One shuttle every 2.5 hours at night is not enough. The drivers, however are courtious and lovely however. the rooms are very clean and well stocked. Two flat screens, microwave and empty fridge. I am truly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, and Nice TV's”
Reviews.Author: sunsetsinparadise
Reviews.Content: Early morning guests making noice in hallway talking loudly and doors slamming. Good news is that if you close the bedroom door and close the window shades, it will be dark, quiet and perfect for sleeping in. We enjoyed the free breakfast buffet with all the staff very helpful. Shuttle was a wait after fireworks ay Epcot but we had time to look at the shops and not rush out of the park. We liked having two TV's - very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: PeteNB10
Reviews.Content: Location is awesome, it is on an easy to find corner, and at night the building is outlined with lights. The rooms have all new furniture, with 2 flat panel TV's. The separate bedroom is awesome when someone wants to sleep in. I have stayed here twice and noticed both times how extremely good the housekeeping is... everything is cleaned everyday... you can see the attention to detail (no dust on table tops etc.). If you don't want housekeeping to come in, just leave the 'do not disturb' sign on the door, they were very respectful of that. The air conditioning can be controlled, and it is not noisy. The only noise I noticed was when people let their doors slam, instead of closing them gently. You can hear water running in adjacent rooms. Also, it is much quieter on the back side of the hotel, away from the traffic side. The breakfast is just so-so, the eggs are like powdered eggs, and sometimes are very wet. The restaurant on site has incredibly good food and good service.

Reviews.Title: “The Buena Vista Suites exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: mom2my4boyz
Reviews.Content: Wonderful quality at a great value! We would stay here again if we visit Orlando. The location was perfect and easy to access. Our only issue is that the breakfast food was bland and not a large variety (one day ham was served and it was left in water--when I tasted it--it tasted like water because it was water logged). Overall though a great place to stay. We had 2 teens and 2 young children.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location to Disney, great value with free breakfast, but not very helpul service staff.”
Reviews.Author: gostatepack
