Reviews.Content: Again... the value was great. With free full breakfast, it is hard to pass up this deal. The housekeeping and restaurant staff were excellent and eager to help. The front desk and service help, not so much. In regards to visiting Disney, they were only helpful in trying to sell a 'deal.' When asked about downtown Orlando, the response was 'You won't like it.' Uh, how do you know? In my opinion, lousy front desk help, but fortunately for us we were there just for Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Whoopie97
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that my husband and I stayed at this hotel. When my husband suggested that we go to Disney World for our vacation this year (2010), there was no question in which hotel we would stay. We also had 2 of our close friends with us this time around and without hesitation suggested that they stay at this hotel too. We all enjoyed comfortable, clean rooms, a great breakfast each morning, and very helpful and pleasant staff. If you're planning to stay in the Orlando area and need a place to stay, this hotel is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: puddingchieftain
Reviews.Content: Not a luxury hotel but a good deal. Suites ideal for families with kids. Decent & reliable complimentary breakfast. Friendly staff. Clean. Extremely convenient to Disney (we rented a car so did not use their shuttle).

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value, Excellent for Families”
Reviews.Author: ramco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buena Vista Suites 5 nights while visiting Disney. Our suite consisted of a reasonably large bedroom, a somewhat small sitting room with a pull-out queen size bed, large screen TVs in both rooms, a bathroom, and separate lavatory. The suite is satisfactory for a family of 4.. Room and hotel very clean and well-maintained.. Hotel staff very friendly and helpfui. Full breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon, pancakes or French toast, cereals, juices, yogurt, fruit, etc. Very satisfying. Our 8 year old enjoyed the outdoor heated pool. We were pleased with the excellent daily shuttle service to and from the Disney parks and you may want to consider it rather than your own car. We paid $99 for 3 nights, $149 and $89 for the other two nights. An excellent value for families. We would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great "Good Neighbor" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andreoliway2
Reviews.Content: The room we had was very comfortable. We got a great price on the room. We had more space for a great price then if we had stayed at a Villa in Disney. The hotel is about 3 miles from disney property which made it easy to get around. One road took us right to the parks and the other road (hotel is on corner) took us to Downtown Disney area and other great restaraunts. The staff was very knowledgable and helped guide us when we needed it. You can't beat the FREE breakfast each morning! We also had a very good dinner at the hotel restaraunt. The hotel is kept neat and clean. The location of the hotel made it very easy to get to and from the Orlando Airport. Many other great extras in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Nice”
Reviews.Author: travlnthru
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. We needed a room that had a bath tub...our first room didn't have one, but they moved us with no problem. We really appreciated how accommodating they were. The staff was friendly from the moment we arrived. We went for our son's 1st birthday and our group used about 8 rooms. I didn't hear any complaints from anyone. Having a one-year-old, we only like staying in suites where we don't have to have our baby in our room with us. This was a good set-up for us. The bathroom was in-between the sitting area and bedroom, but actually in the bedroom. They have a large breakfast, eggs and toast to order - but no fresh fruit. Great prices, friendly staff. They have a shuttle available to parks. We didn't use the shuttle, but It was nice to know the service was available. The biggest drawback for us was sleeping - we were so tired that we slept anyhow - we didn't love our pillows. My husband and I have completely different tastes in pillows, but neither of us attempted to find out if there were other options since we were only staying for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: KidAstro
Reviews.Content: A family member found this hotel for us on the Mouse Savers website. It is quite close to the Disney Parks, but we did not take advantage of their free shuttle as we has originally planned because there was only one return shuttle scheduled after the nightly fireworks at the park (immediately following), and we were afraid it would be full & we'd be stuck. The were no huge red-flags, but I was left feeling a little disappointed. The breakfast wasn't great, the tub dripped & the toilet would get stuck running. We just wanted to use one of the luggage carts to load up for our departure, as we had upon our arrival, but instead had someone come up along with the cart. We were not quite ready, so we had to rush to finish packing, & had to tip for a service we hadn't planned on or wanted. Probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - value for money”
Reviews.Author: SueMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 4 nights in January, 2010 to thaw out from north USA (NYC, Boston), but it was not to be. It was coldest weather they had experienced since the 1970's! But it did not matter - we still did Disney! This hotel is great, breakfast is included and we had a two room suite - two queen beds and a sofa in the other room. Parking available and free. The hotel provides a shuttle bus to and from the Disney parks - no cost! Well worth using the bus only one stop before you arrive at Disney. Microwave oven in room as well as a fridge, coffee maker. Laundry facilities also available. Great shopping to be done at Orlando - found the outlet shops and went shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: EPadilla
Reviews.Content: The accomodation and facilities is excellent. The rooms are spacious and give you a home away from home automosphere. I was pleasantly surprised at the continental breakfast. The cook made so friendly and remember us the next day. WOW, I'm impressed. The Bistro was quiet and elegant enough to feel you're at a 4 star restaurant. All shopping and entertainment areas are a few miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better---”
Reviews.Author: VeroLady
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best value for your money---It has been completely remodeled since we stayed there 4 yrs ago and all the furnishings are terrific---the beds are specially comfortable. Offering free parking and free transportation to Disney are both great and the bus company was so prompt and the drivers so helpful. Our meal in the dinning room one evening was quite good and our granddaughter got to eat free. I searched many other hotels including those on Disney property and none could come close to offering all the amenities that Buena Vista Suites offered us for a very resonable price.

Reviews.Title: “This is where I will stay for now on.”
Reviews.Author: Legowow
Reviews.Content: Rooms perfect for families with small children. A big screen T.V. in each room: perfect. Quiet and comfortable and conveniently located to everything. We have stayed in various hotels around Lake Buena Vista and this is the one we will return to again and again. Super great prices and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Looking At Other Hotels First For The Money”
Reviews.Author: MIMez
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was ok and served our purpose while we were down in Orlando. The maid service daily always had the beds made very nice and clean towels. However, the room was tight for being advertised as a two room suite; the rooms are not as roomy as staying at an Embassy Suites. One of the features included in the price was the buffet; but I would recommend this not be a deciding factor in booking this hotel. The breakfast buffet had basic choices and was overly packed on a daily basis; meeting rooms had to be opened so that people could sit in there to eat since the dining area could not house the crowd. The pool is nothing special, so we spent our pool days at my Brother's timeshare down the road. Parking at night was a problem for us and had to park in the back of the hotel since we were getting to the room after 10 PM EST. I was very disappointed that this hotel wanted to charge over $8 daily for LAN or WiFi connection. Next time, I will look at other hotel options before considering booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay--could have done without the daily sales pitches, however.”
Reviews.Author: divanurse
Reviews.Content: Took the family for a trip to visit relatives and Disney World. Chose this hotel mainly because of the location, the rate, and the full breakfast offered daily. Easy to find, parking is nice, front desk personnel very friendly and polite. If I really had to choose something to complain about, it would have to be the time share desk located in the lobby. I was not aware of this until my daughters and I were walking to the pool and I was "suckered" in with "Do you have your tickets to Disney World?" Of course they are very friendly until you figure out what is up, then not so much. We got accosted by whomever was behind that desk every morning on our way to breakfast. We just smiled and said "no thanks" and kept walking. Our room was comfortable, cleaned every day, and we had plenty of towels. The fold-out couch wasn't the most comfortable, but the kids did ok with it. We all had plenty of room and having 2 tv's was a huge plus. It was also very nice having a fridge available to keep water bottles cold and leftover food. There is a CVS across the street, the kids and I walked over a couple times to buy supplies and snacks. I also thought they charged a bit much for internet access, but after researching other hotels, found this is pretty universal. We did enjoy our stay, and it was very convenient and close to all the attractions. The breakfast buffet was pretty much the same food every day, but it was hot and saved us a lot of money since we didn't have to buy a meal for the 5 of us to start the day. We stayed 6 nights, and I made sure to leave a tip for our housekeeper, who made sure to thank me when she saw us coming or going from our room. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: dhazelett2
Reviews.Content: Very clean, friendly and close to the attractions. Definately worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here the next time we are in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Renae94
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a party of 7 to Orlando, 3 adults and 4 kids ages 6-16. Hotel was very clean, rooms were spacious and the staff was very friendly. Stay includes a free American breakfast buffet which was very tasty and a great way to start off your day. My kids are very picky eaters and they had something for everyone. Hotel location was perfect and very close to Disney. This hotel offers a shuttle that we did not take advantage of but the next time I will definitely use. Shuttle drops you off right at the ticket window instead of you having to park and tak the tram, you can leave the park and come back if you need to and most importantly at the end of the night when everyone is waiting for the tram I saw the hotel shuttle sitting there waiting to take people directly to the hotel...lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: olga92
Reviews.Content: Buena Vista Suites was renovated last year, rooms very spacious and comfortable. We stayed in King Suite, so our son had his own room with sofa and TV. Hotel breakfast was included-buffet was good except coffee and orange juice. Front desk people were very helpful-we got restaurant reservations and coupons that saved us $$. Their pool is rather small (thinking of summertime). We used their free shuttle to go to Disney parks, however, they do not provide transportation to Universal-daily parking there is 14$-keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: LuvDisneyCt
Reviews.Content: The Buena Vista is a great place to stay...nice rooms and wonderful atomosphere. The staff is extremely helpful and kind. The cost of the room is worth...the free breakfast in the AM. Close to Disney...As a DVC member I highly recommend this hotel for Friday/Saturday night stays to reduce point usage.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations for the budget-conscious traveler”
Reviews.Author: julielinda
Reviews.Content: My extended family stayed at the Buena Vista Suites for three nights for a family reunion. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was always very pleasant and responsive. There were lots of kids in our group so the breakfast buffet was ideal. It allowed the kids to "fuel up" before heading to the park. We stayed here in 1998 for a reunion on a larger scale. We were pleased then and this visit was no different.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied with hotel especially the price”
Reviews.Author: aloew_9
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 20month and 3.5 year old to Disney for 3 days. We were very satisfied with our stay at Buena Vista Suites. We chose this hotel over others because of the price and the 2 separate rooms. We were able to put the kids to bed and stay up for a couple of hours. It is very close to the Disney properties. My only complaints are simple ones. The couch in the first room is not comfortable, but I have never found a couch at a hotel to be comfortable. The second complaint is that down comforters on the beds are way too heavy for central Florida. Check out the hotel website for their one day Thursday sale price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and accommodating lodging.”
Reviews.Author: lcapalini
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice with plenty of room - most importantly they were clean. I stayed on the front side the first night, VERY noisy. Good thing I'd downloaded the white noise app for my Blackberry, I needed it. Due to a plumbing problem, I was moved the second night to the other side - much quieter and more pleasant. Issues: Wireless Internet only worked by the front door - sort-of. Not great access. Why doesn't the TV include Lifetime and Bravo? 5 or 6 sports channels, not much for the female traveler. Found that frustrating. And, I really hate when the pizza people come through dropping flyers through the door. It scared me when I was sitting there and the guys made a loud noise and the paper came flying through the door.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Vacanzababy
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay off Disney Property this time and enjoyed the spacious suite at the Buena Vista Suites. The room was clean and pleasant. The in room service food was very very good. Just wish the complimentary buffet breakfast was better.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: shelbys96
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel.Very clean. Front desk staff was friendly. Rooms were good-sized, but very dark.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Buena Vista!”
Reviews.Author: Quintin46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there from October 4 - 11 as I attended the IFMA conference at the Orange County Convention Center. Loved the hotel including; the renovated rooms, the jacuzzi tub in the King suite, the friendliness of the staff, the fitness room (more updated equipment would be a plus), the complimentary/excellent buffet breakfast, and the Valencia room for dining. I had a couple of problems with my room that the engineers addressed quickly and professionally. My wife enjoyed the pool and the helpful people at the Expedia booth but did not like the maid staffs lack of courtesy. On several occasions throughout the week, she was surprised and inconvenienced by the maid staff entering the room without sufficient notification! Otherwise, I was very pleased with my experience in your hotel. I would stay with you guys again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and pleasant employees”
Reviews.Author: debbie072356
Reviews.Content: Our two day stay was a great experience. From the time we checked in, to the time we left, every minute was an enjoyable one. The room was spacious and meticulously clean. The two flat screen tv's got great reception, the bed was very comfortable, the employees were always smiling, helpful and knowledgeable, and the whole hotel was kept clean. The free breakfast was enjoyable also! The location to the parks was about a 5 to 10 minute ride, so that was a plus since we had a vehicle. A couple of downsides were that we could not purchase park tickets in the lobby without sitting thru some sort of "pitch"....so we just purchased our tickets at the gate to the park, and the internet connection (which cost 8.95/day) received a very weak signal and took forever to connect. Overall it was a wonderful place to stay, close enough to where we needed to go. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! My family loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mermaid04
Reviews.Content: My family loved this hotel! Once entering the room both my husband and oldest son said I had done good picking BVS to stay at. The two tvs was GREAT to have! My husband and I could have one while the kids watched what they wanted to on another. The beds....OH MY!!! Excellent beds to sleep in. I love getting away, but always have problems when it comes to sleeping in different beds. I had no problems here. The front desk staff was very friendly. Our room was on the first floor and faced the back parking lot so no noise for us. As for the breakfast, never tried it. Family was ready to get to Disney to check in there. We are planning another trip to FL in a couple of years and plan to start out our vaca at Universal and plan on staying here when we do.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place could have cost a bit less”
Reviews.Author: elainmir
Reviews.Content: The place is beautiful, the staff kind and competent, rooms VERY clean but I wish the breakfast buffett were more expansive. You could have spent 25-30$ less at other places and gotten the same type breakfast and room. I did love the cleanliness of the room though.

Reviews.Title: “Effective, Efficient, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: yelblack77
Reviews.Content: First of all, after driving for a long period of time the last thing you should encounter is a poor reception at check-in. Upon my arrival I received a friendly greeting. The attendant swiped my card, gave me my room keys (room was on the first floor), and welcomed me all in under five minutes! The rooms were gorgeous and smelled fresh. The room had everything we needed and more. The first night we ordered from room service and the food was some of the best I've ever had. The rooms were very spacious. The breakfast was good, but it is best to get there early. This hotel is in a good location; close to shopping, eating, and Disney. For the price I paid, service and atmosphere was far above and beyond what I expected. I will be a frequent guess of this hotel. EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: retarmyltc
Reviews.Content: First class accomodations, extra large breakfast, Concierge went out of his way to be knowledgable and outstanding in his job. Will definitely reccomend you to others. The Robertsons

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay, very impressed, held family of 6!”
Reviews.Author: crojemupeo
Reviews.Content: I've never rated a hotel before but was so impressed with this one that I felt compelled. We spent a week at disney but needed a hotel the night before and after our booked EDE package so we stayed here on both ends of our disney trip and I was super impressed by this hotel. First off, all 6 people in my family had a bed (compared to 2 of the kids being on a floor in a regular 2-bed hotel) and 2 of the beds were queen size and COMFY!! they were better than the beds at our WDW cabin! lots of space in the Buena Vista room, 2 GREAT tv's, the breakfast was impressive and was included with our room, and the rate was amazing!! I'm overly impressed and would even consider this hotel for our entire disney trip next time -- excellent quality, roomy, comfy, and cheaper than WDW! Can't speak highly enough for Buena Vista Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkDad_of_2
Reviews.Content: Suites big enough for kids to burn off energy after long car ride. Nicely furnished. Very clean. Comfortable beds. Nice contintental breakfast included. Free parking most hotels charge for anymore.Outdoor pool. Nice front desk staff very friendly. Short car ride to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, good price, free breakfast, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: KarenFL
Reviews.Content: We had a conference at the Marriott World Center where the rooms were $169 a night plus $20 for parking. We booked a Florida residents rate of $81 which included a buffet breakfast, a very nice room with two queen size beds with lots of pillows, a studio area with a large screen TV, refrigerator and microwave. The place was clean, it was just the second day the maid left the towels on the desk instead of putting them in the bathroom and I had to try to find them after I washed my hands. A request for a shower cap took so long my friend went and bought one. The buffet included eggs cooked to order in addition to the usual other items. The people working in the restaurant for breakfast were very good. The egg cook was well organized and the young man busing the dishes and wiping the tables was fast and did an excellent job keeping the tables clean. We were too tired to use the swimming pool, but it looked nice. It was only a $5 taxi ride to the Marriott. We plan to stay there again when we go next year to the conference and recommended it to our colleagues at the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DonfromCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buena Vista Suites for 5 nights while on vacation. The rooms were gorgeous and very luxurious! We had no problems with the complimentary breakfast that was offered. They had something for everyone at the buffet and we enjoyed the breakfast each morning before heading out. We were there for breakfast around 8 and had no problems with lines. The pool could have used a little more attention.....but was very refreshing after a busy day. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will surely go back here again! Just minutes from all the attractions but more affordable than staying at one of the Disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, very friendly staff, great stay”
Reviews.Author: booklovingmama
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old son's comment was: "This is the best hotel that we have ever stayed at, good job, Mom." The suite was beautiful and clean, beds were comfortable, and the staff was so friendly that my husband told the front desk how great they all were. Breakfast was delicious. It was close to attractions. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Came back 4 months later.”
Reviews.Author: rocketsdad
Reviews.Content: Me, wife, & son (13 yrs. old) arrived on July 28th & departed on August 1, 2009. We stayed here just 4 months ago. I again rate this hotel as better than average. I once again believe their only flaw is the breakfast. If they would "ramp up" the selection & quality of food it would be a great hotel. If you are going to Disney or Seaworld the location of this hotel couldn't be any better. They are both just minutes away. We also made a day trip to Busch Gardens in Tampa, Fl. & it took only 55 minutes to get there from parking lot to parking lot. Odds are we'll stay here next time we're in Orlando. If they would improve their breakfast we wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Great location, Very helpful staff....”
Reviews.Author: allenfamilyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Buena Vista Suites in June/July and we found that staying at the Suites was an enjoyable and rewarding experience. We traveled from Australia with 2 children (aged 11 and 8) and from the very start of reserving our rooms to when we actually arrived was nothing more than exceptional. We arrived around 9.30pm and the staff welcomed us with a smile, the rooms were exactly what they had described and very comfortable for our size family. The rooms were cleaned everyday except for a couple of days when we asked for them not to be but other than that there was a surplus of towels and the beds were always made to a high standard. Breakfast was included in the accommodation cost and the whole package was very reasonable. They have an onsite tour guide person who advises what shows you can see, where you can eat and other things to do whilst staying in Orlando. We found them all to be very helpful on what's to do in Orlando. We had a fantastic trip and we wish to thank Buena Vista Suites for making it so special.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: zendisney
Reviews.Content: The Buena Vista Suites was a clean hotel. The big screen TV's were nice. The beds were ok. The bathroom was clean The water pressure was ok in the shower. It was loud at night. There were people walking up and down the hallways making a lot of noise. I think the doors need to be more sound proof. There were annoying ads for local pizza places being stuffed in the door periodically... I thought that was annoying too. The free breakfast was really nasty and the coffee was gross. They had eggs to order... I asked for over medium eggs and toast. The eggs were over cooked and the toast was burnt. We opted for McD's around the corner. I would stay again but nit for breakfast. We stayed here because we were on our way to a Disney Resort a needed a one night room that was safe and clean. That is what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive Hotel.....Wonderful Stay!!! WILL STAY HERE AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: lerNewfoundland
Reviews.Content: VERY IMPRESSIVE HOTEL.....WONDERFUL STAY!!!! My husand, myself, and our two children stayed at the Buena Vista Suites for 6 nights (July 11th - July 16th) and loved every minute of our stay. The location was perfect....close to the amusement parks, water parks, prime shopping outlets, food, etc. The front desk staff here were always helpful and friendly. We found the room exceptionally clean and spacious. The cleaning staff vaccumed our room every day and we always had perfectly made beds and more than enough clean towels for us to use. Two flat screen TVs in the suite. The beds had feather duvets and were very cozy and comfortable, and the sofa bed was great for the kids too. The pool was always warm and had many lounge chairs to relax in, and hot tub was great!! A "very tasty" full American breakfast for all guests was included in the hotel cost, and included (scrambled eggs, bacon, ham, pancakes, hash browns, cream of wheat, porridge, toast, bagels, assorted cereals, apple juice, orange juice, white milk, chocolate milk, jams, cream cheese, etc). They also cooked eggs over-easy, well done, or however else you wanted them. This hotel also offered a tennis court and basketball court, all you had to do is ask the front desk staff for the racquets and balls...no charge. Obviously, I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We would DEFINITELY stay here again. As a matter of fact, we left for Daytona on July 17th but returned the same evening, (long story - check out my "not good" review of "LaPlaya Hotel, Daytona"). My family and I came back to Buena Vista Suites and stayed for an additional 4 nights before leaving for home. Signed: Lisa, NL, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, close to Disney and all parks”
Reviews.Author: TheHons
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Buena Vista Suites in Orlando to do a tour of starwoods time share. The staff is very helpful and always smiling. They had a GREAT hot breakfast every morning Monday thru Friday. Our room has plenty of space for the two of us. A living room with a couch and love seat and flat screen TV made in nice when my husband laid down to rest. The safe in our room was locked so we called down at the desk. We went to breakfast and by the time we came back it was fixed. The location was close to the major highways to get to all the parks. The only draw back was the pool was small. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Space”
Reviews.Author: tink1969
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after looking on trip advisor. I had booked two other hotels but decided to go with this one after looking at the reviews. I was not disappointed. The rooms were very clean and the extra space was very nice to have after an eleven hour drive. The beds were super comfortable and even the pull out sofa was very comfortable according to my oldest child. The breakfast was good. It was also nice to have the two flat screen tvs in different rooms. This made it much more relaxing. We stayed one night and enjoyed being able to streach out without being all over each other like in a normal hotel room. The pictures on the website and on trip advisor are very accurate. If you go and happen to find a feather, don't freak out they are from the decrotative pillows on the bed. Great place to stay and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Awful Shuttle Service!”
Reviews.Author: MorganLuv
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, the price was reasonable and our room was nice. They gave us the wrong room at first but fixed it once we went back down to the front desk. We thought the breakfast buffet was good and nice to have included with our stay. But the shuttle service was awful!! It was either an hour late or 15 minutes early leaving us stranded and having to pay for a cab. We called customer service to complain about the problem's and they were totally rude. They said "too bad you will have to pay for a cab". We liked the hotel but we won't return. There are better choices. If you stay here, make sure you rent a car. We stayed here on vacation from 5/16/09 to 5/23/09.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: abbeycrombie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I planned a trip to Disney and chose Buena Vista Suites for accommodations. The room was very spacious and well kept. Location is ideal being only a few minutes away from the parks. They offer a shuttle service but we decided to drive in each time. There is also a pharmacy across the street and a gas station which are all bonuses. They also offer a complimentary breakfast buffet every morning. The food was decent. Overall, our experience was a good one and I would recommend friends and family to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, awesome location for shoppers!”
Reviews.Author: SamaIndia
Reviews.Content: Value for money: Excellent value for money (got the queen suite for 80$ a night including breakfast). Good rooms with two large LCD TVs, very good beds and a good bathroom. Break fast was good too with chioce of made to order eggs, fruits and cereal and the regular breads. It aslo provides free parking if you have your own car Location : very close to a mall, other stores and very good eating places. Services : The hotel customer service was very good and they also run shuttles to outlet malls and disney. Cleanliness : carpets could be cleaner but the linen, towels and bathrooms were very good

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good food, not outstanding housekeeping service - but average.”
Reviews.Author: Hgandhi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during the Mothers Day weekend. Great location so better off saving money at an off Disney resort. They have shuttle service, too. Nice hotel, best thing was the complimentary buffet breakfast for my kids. For the price we paid and overall experience - I can let go of the not-so-outstanding housekeeping service there. The fridge is nice to have but it takes a day to get cooler (they turn it on when you check in!) We did not use the microwave but I guess thats nice to have as well. Two tvs - makes it nice for those who want to rest or stay up watching tv or just having different channels. Had to call twice for extra towels. One time - they did not put fitted sheets on the bed when we asked for a linen change request. The queen beds are spacious enough for an adult and a kid - better than other hotels where you have full beds to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while visiting the parks”
Reviews.Author: beevet
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here, with our 3 daughters (ages 7,14,14) and it was overall a wonderful experience. Having 2 separate rooms was a bonus (and 2 separate TV's). The breakfast was pretty good, although I imagine if you stayed for an extended period you might get bored with it. Fresh fruit would be nice in FL, but when you consider its free...ANY fruit is a bonus. Loved the yogurt too. Never tried the shuttle service. DIdn't seem like they had a lot of options for leaving the park middle of the afternoon, so we took our rental car instead. I figure we saved on breakfast, so didn't mind paying for parking at Disney. I see a lot of reviewers never made it to the pool. We did once, and the water temp was great. The pool was small, but there weren't many people there. My only complaint is with the laundromat. Think they need servicing, or else we just picked 2 bad dryers, b/c even with two cycles...our clothes were still pretty wet. We complained to the front desk, and they gave us our quarters back. Oh, I have to end talking about the BEDS!!! I've NEVER been in a hotel room with beds this comfortable! Made it really hard to get up in the morning!! I slept SO well! Overall, a great stay at Buena Vista!

Reviews.Title: “The maid lost all our items”
Reviews.Author: Marcie77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on vacation in September 2008. We checked in and went to the park for the day. When we arrived all our stuff was gone. THis included all our luggage, clothes and shoes. We went downstairs to tell them we had been robbed and they told us that the maid 'thought' we had checked out and put all our stuff in the lost and found. WE had to go through all the lost and found and try to find our items. Most of it was more 'lost' then found. My son lost all his good clothes and his duffle bag. My eldery aunt lost her slippers and camera. Needless to say, we dont know what other things we lost since you dont really remember every single thing you took on vacation. The manager Vika Fiftha never offered any compensation. All they told us was to mail them all our receipts of the items we lost and they would go through the insurance company for us to be reimbursed. How are we suppose to find the receipt of every item we purchased and took on this vacation? I am sure we were just getting the brush off. This is the worst service I have ever received and I would never go to this hotel again. They ruined our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great Value”
Reviews.Author: AlvaroLuis
Reviews.Content: We (me, my wife, and another couple) stayed in this hotel for 5 nights during our recent trip to Orlando. Got a great rate through Mousesavers for exactly what we were looking for: 1-bedroom suite. LCD tv's were nice and the in-room small fridge very convenient. There was a microwave also but we never got to use it. Complimentary breakfast was... well... FREE!... so don't get too picky! Eggs made to order, toast, bagels, hash brown, grits, cold cereal, etc. Good enough to get you started every morning. Tip: if you're serious about your morning cup of coffee, better bring your own and make it yourself. I like mine strong and first thing in the morning, so the coffee maker in the room was a welcome surprise. Parking spots in the front are scarce, like many have said, but there's additional parking on the back of the building. The pool looked good but we were too busy with the parks, so never got to use it. My only complaint would be the rather relaxed security at the front desk. There were many times when we got back to the hotel late at night to find an empty desk at the lobby (maybe that's why we got so many pizza delivery flyiers under the door every night)

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: ERRNCARI
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe king suite...it was wonderful...very clean and comfortable..We requested a quiet room away from the elevator...which was ready upon our arrival..Very close to Disney...far enough away from the busy I drive....The free buffet breakfast each morning was helpful ...a quick breakfast before heading out to the parks..The food was good...made to order eggs...alternating meats...cereal etc...fruit and OJ was probably canned...would have preferred fresh..Parking lot fills up quickly at night....spaces are very narrow...we found larger spots around the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price”
Reviews.Author: upnorth777
Reviews.Content: This place was great esp. for the price. We stayed 9 days from April 24 to May 3. The rooms are large, clean, comfy beds, new TV's. We booked through mouse savers and got the $89 rate. When we got there we asked and were given a free upgrade to a king suite with a jacuzzi tub which was great after long days at the park. The free breakfast buffet was great, a couple of long lines later in the am but they always opened a second line if it got too long. Location was excellent less than 5 minutes to the parks. We did not use the shuttle, we had done this before with other hotels and don't like being on a rigid schedule. It is a little more to rent a car and park it but the freedom is worth it. Outlet mall is less than a mile away as well as a Walmart super centre for groceries. Microwave and fridge in room was helpful in deferring the cost of food at the parks. Pool was a little small but clean and we ended up sitting around it with our own cooler of beer and own snacks. No one seemed to care. The only caveat I would have is they seem to book a lot of school groups. There were lots of teens but all were well behaved and not running in the halls etc. I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: snowfaery5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our niece and nephew to Orlando for 2 days. We stayed at this hotel on March 27th for only one night. It was a great stay and would definitely stay here again and for longer. We checked in after going to Sea World, around 7 p.m. Staff was very friendly and efficient. We had a 2 queen suite with a pull out bed. It was great having a door between the living room and bedroom so our nephew could basically have his own room at night. The only negative is the bathroom is in the bedroom area so if the door is shut, whomever is staying on the pull out couch has to come into the bedroom to use the bathroom. It wasn't that big of a deal for us since it was one night. Both rooms had big flat screen tv's. The beds were SO comfy with down comforters. The hotel was very quiet. We were right by the elevator and didn't really hear anything. The next morning we ate at the free breakfast buffet. It was just average. For free of course it tasted just fine! The selection is minimal. Eggs, dried out french toast sticks, ham, grits, donuts, hashbrowns, bagels, toast. Honestly when you have two hungry teenage kids, a free average buffet breakfast was great to have. Saved us money before going to Universal Studios. I would definitely recommend this hotel for families. Location was great and overall was just a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average service.”
Reviews.Author: Deah
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the BVS March 26-31 while attending a medical conference. The staff are very accommodating and go out of their way to be helpful. The rooms are suites with two double beds, pull out sofa bed, refrigerator and two TVs. Our room had comfy beds and appeared to be recently updated. Unfortunately, it appears there had been problems with a leaking ceiling, the area had been patched and painted, but still leaked. Breakfast is included with the price of the room. I only ate breakfast one morning, it was average. Probably a good deal for anyone with children. Pool is smaller and the area was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nsrosie
Reviews.Content: We loved the layout of the rooms. They have been nicely updated and the linens were great. Water pressure was also very nice. I would say that the rooms have been renovated to a nicer degree than the lobby and breakfast area. They were nothing special at all but the rooms were quite nice, particularly for the price. The two tvs were great for our family and it was nice to be able to put the kids to bed and retire to the sitting room for a while to unwind while they slept. Also in the room were a microwave and refrigerator. I was not too impressed with the breakfast but it was free and certainly worked just fine. On the second day we realized that you could order bagels or wheat toast which seemed healthier than the sugary donuts and fruit loops that my kids enjoyed the first day. The location is very convenient to disney. It is extremely easy to get to and from epcot from the hotel. I had forgotten that if you are not staying at one of the disney resorts (like we have done in the past) that you have to park at the transportation center and take the monorail to the magic kingdom. Not a deal killer but it was an extra step that I had not considered. All in all, it is not the ritz but it was clean and the rooms were nice. For the price, it worked out quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Everything they promise! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: joty37
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 5 looking for a moderate to nice hotel with room to sleep and a free breakfast every morning. This hotel provided that and more! Rooms were recently renovated, and although not large, they were adequate size for all five of us with all new bedding, carpets, tvs, etc. Two separate rooms to give us some space. Breakfast was amazing -- full with eggs, potatoes, bacon or ham or sausage, cereal, fruit, coffee, juice, toast/bagel/muffins/donuts, and an egg man to make eggs to order -- WOW! Shuttles to the park were nice luxury busses with great drivers. Pool/hot tub/game room for downtimes. Great price and location -- definitely would recommend and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if you're looking for something affordable, close to Disney without compromising on comfort”
Reviews.Author: freezing4
Reviews.Content: A familiy of 4 (children ages 10 and 7), we wanted a bit more space than a standard room and be close to the theme parks. I had done my homework (using Tripavisor, of course) and picked a one-bedroom suite at Buena Vista Suites: it was a great choice. I feel we had a great deal (thanks to a tip on the mousesavers.com website) at $99. a night. The location is great: it is about 5 minutes to the entrance to Disney World, and also close to the restaurants and shopping, making it very convenient. There aren't too many hotels closer to the parks (even those in Downtown Disney aren't closer, not to mention more expensive). All the rooms have been redone recently so everything looks nice and clean, nothing outdated. The one-bedroom suite has a living room area, with a large flat-screen tv, a fridge, a micro-wave oven and coffe-maker. The bathroom with exterior sink/vanity separates from the bedroom area. The bedroom is cozy with high-quality linens, extra cushions, and very comfy beds (even the kids noticed...) and a 2nd flat-screen tv. The rooms are not very big, but the layout it is well done there and it is very convenient with enough storage space. Water pressure was OK / standard for Florida hotels trying to consume less water... The service was good: we were able to check-in at 1:30 pm. The free breakfast buffet was a plus: it saved us time and money. Nothing fancy, but it was fine. They had cereals, mini-donuts, yogourt, fruits (canned unfortunately) and a hot selection alternating waffles or pancakes or biscuits, ham or bacon or sausages and scrambled eggs and potatoes. You could also order your eggs and toasts or bagels. There are free shuttles to the parks, but I was glad we had rented a car for more flexibility (they did not seem to run very often). The pool was nice and clean but not very big (in March, there was very little people there, even if the water was heated) with enough lounging chairs and palm trees in the background. We had a problem one night: there was almost no hot water. We called and their response was as it should be. They apologized and said they would send someone check the boiler right away and sure enough, 15 minutes later, there was plenty hot water. What didn't I like ? Not much. Like many Orlando hotels, it's located on a busy road . There is not many trees and you have a view .. on the road. Also, you can hear a bit of the trafic noise even on the 7th (and last) floor. It was not a problem, but I would ask for a room on the other side of the building. I would definitely recommend this hotel and if we go back to Orlando, it will be at Buena Vista Suites

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, Quite, Good Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: nancydrew43
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel compared to many in Orlando. We got a 2 room suite for 109.00 and was very pleased. We are use to staying in Disney hotels such as the Contemporary but did not want to spend that kind of money this trip. Everything about this hotel was very nice. The beds and pillows are actually better then what's available at the Disney hotels, in our opinion. The Staff is very helpful and kind. We didn't use the pool as it was way too cold to swim, nor did we eat here, so we can not comment on these areas. Would definitely stay here again at these prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying at.”
Reviews.Author: bsxter
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days at the end of Feb 2009. The rooms are nice. Clean. Have new furniture. Pool is small you cant swim for exersize. Hotel bistro is quiet ,cozy. Front desk staff is average. There is small complex across the street with a CVS, 7-11. Pizza place , Chinese food. You have to run across busy road so watch out. The convention center is one block away 3 minute walk.. The free breakfast is ok ate less every day and skipped the last day. If you want healthy food choices are few.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean room”
Reviews.Author: 999mom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week long vacation at Disneyworld. Loved the 2 room suite - perfect size for 2 adults and 2 school age kids. Rooms are nice, beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean. The service was good as well. The breakfast buffet was very good. There is a drugstore, pizza and convenience store across the street. The free shuttle service to and from the parks was good, although the shuttle only ran a couple of times in the morning and a couple of times in the evening - check the schedule if this is important to you. The shuttle also goes to multiple parks, so there are times you are on the bus for awhile (but it is large and comfortable).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and affordable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: qqq266
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at $99/night starting on New Year's Day 2009. The suites are roomy with two comfortable queen size beds and a sofa bed. The complimentary breakfast buffet was better than expected. We took the scheduled free shuttle to Epcot and back. All in all, this was an excellent pre-cruise experience.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Jurimo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the weekend. It was even better than we expected based on the reviews we read in advance. With the thousands of choices in Orlando it was very hard to choose. We made a wise choice with this one. The rooms were spacious, staff was friendly and welcoming, the breakfast was much better than most 'complimentary' breakfasts. The location was perfect for the parks and other things we wished to do in Orlando. The price was reasonable and we took advance of the Thursday specials. Look for this on their website. Without question, we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: North_Waterloo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an extended family vacation. We were at Buena Vista Suites over Christmas and we were not disappointed. After a long day at the parks it was wonderful to come back to clean, comfortable rooms. The renovations are beautiful... we loved the two-room idea... the kids could be in one room and the adults could visit in another. We bought our Disney tickets from guest services and they even threw in a one time fun pass that allowed us to get into the Disney waterpark. Breakfast was really good however I admit that after 7 days you did get a little tired of the same things... my guess is that most people don't stay quite that long. Breakfast can be really busy especially at 9:00 a.m. but when you spend all day standing in lines at Disney what is another 5 minutes? The kids LOVED the pool... I believe it is saltwater, NO chlorine... this allowed the kids to play as much as they wanted without their eyes getting irritated. We really enjoyed the hot tub every night... it was the perfect thing for aching muscles. The staff were all friendly, the house keeping was excellent and there is another elevator down the left side that you don't have to wait long for! Even the shuttle services to the parks were comfortable and well done. The time schedules at first look constricting but they aren't if you learn how the routes work. It was wonderful to catch a luxury bus instead of fighting traffic and having to first pay for and then find parking. We all agreed that we would not hesitate to stay here again. Go, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for familiy”
Reviews.Author: chica07
Reviews.Content: I just got back from taking my husband, 3 year old and 7 month old to Disney. We needed a seperate room to put the kids to sleep while still allowing the grownups TV time. This hotel set-up was perfect for that. The rooms were nice and my crawling 7 month old did not get dirty from crawling all over the carpets (this is always a good sign). The breakfast buffet was great. The items were eggs, grits, bacon, biscuits, waffles and pancakes. The Sunday morning buffet was the most crowded. The elevator was fine except on Sunday, it was very difficult to catch one that day. Parking was easy. The hotel is close to Disney and Universal. They also have tickets to the attractions to save you time. Overall it is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: ioneblair
Reviews.Content: My family and friends just stayed at Buena Vista Suites the end of November and being a picky person I was completely satisfied. The rooms were in great shape. There was a small bit of rust in a tub and I am including this only for complete accuracy, it was such a minor thing. Each suite had a flat screen TV in both the bedroom and living room. Be sure to have the front desk configure the channels so that you do not wander into any pay channels. The exercise room is not gym quality but is sufficient for working out a basic routine. I did not go the pool but my family did and had absolutely no complaints. And breakfast was a hot and cold affair that would please and satisfy keeping in mind that you are not at some gourmet restaurant. It is typical buffet breakfast fare with both bulk scrambled eggs and an egg station for made-to-order eggs. It has cereals, yogurt, juice, muffins, potatoes, hot cakes, etc. The front desk was very cordial and professional and there if a small gift shop off the lobby. There is a Walmark not far (a mile or two) and a few stores in that complex, which the front desk will give you directions to. Across the street is a small strip of stores, Pizza place, CVS, Chinese restaurant and a 7-eleven. This is great for families, young adults and budget-minded. Inexpensive without being or feeling cheap or taking away from your vacation. There is also a free movie that was presented in on the main floor off of the lobby, a family movie but my kids weren't interested even if I was, at that time it was Fly Away from Home and they had seen it and wanted to be in the pool. I will definitely go here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mommom1
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel really close to Disney. Rooms have been redone. Beds are super plush. Sitting room was a huge plus when traveling with teenagers. Bathroom bare but clean. Shower was awful--zero pressure. Free breakfast was just ok. Overall, I would stay again, because the price was great, beds were great, and location was great.

Reviews.Title: “It Was A Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: chrisb0707
Reviews.Content: We checked in about 1:00AM after a late flight and everything was good. The hotel updates are all complete so didnt have any trouble or problems with that. The new rooms are very nice with a LCD tv in the bedroom and living room area also. Having the fridge, micro and safe were also nice. We have been to many hotels and had a free breakfast but this place tops them all. The food was great and very good quality. The area was very big and had no problems getting food. If you have kids this is the place to stay with the free food and the couch is a sofa sleeper also. It only takes about 10 minutes to get to the Disney parks also thats if you drive your car which we did but there is also a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere!! Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreGal57
Reviews.Content: Booked a queen suite for 6 nights..Newly renovated small dark rooms.Nothing special.Did I mention small.Breakfast yuk. Slop.No water pressure in the shower.Bathroom has toilet and tub/shower.Small.Sink/vanity in hall between rooms.Small area.Bedroom was small.Access to bed mainly on the nighttable side.I can't imagine a family feeling comfortable here.Requested NO HOUSEKEEPING for our entire stay at the front desk.Hung DO NOT DISTURB sign on door.Left for the day.Returned only to find someone entered our room without our permission.Complained to management.Didn't seem concerned.Didn't care.Invaded our privacy.Kept DO NOT DISTURB sign on door.Left the next day.Returned only to find they entered our room AGAIN this time they moved our personal items around our room.Invaded our privacy again.I'm happy we had our valuables with us .Spoke to management again.Didn't care attitude.Did not feel safe here.Checked out after 3 nights. Take your vacation $$ elsewhere .Learn from our mistake of choosing to stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Orlando Choice for Families”
Reviews.Author: Orland0Traveller
Reviews.Content: The renovation is completed and the rooms are really nice - upscale furnishings and so clean! With 2 children, it was really nice having 2 separate rooms. For $79.95 we got a 2 queen suite; the living room has a small couch, chair, desk & office chair, and breakfront with microwave and refrigerator. The bathroom sink is outside the bathroom, in the short hall between the bedroom and living room. Really nice decor, 2 flat screen TVs, marble sink counter, wonderful beds. I would note that the rooms are a little on the small side. The heated pool was actually warm; you can order food poolside. One note for management - they have yet to replace the outdoor key-card gate to the pool area, and it is in bad shape (dangerous pointy metal at bottom). It's a little odd that, to access to the pool area, you either go through the restaurant or go outside, past people waiting for the shuttle bus, and then to the pool. The breakfast was nice - scrambled eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, pancakes, waffles, muffins, donuts, cereals, canned mixed fruit, etc. You can also order poached or over easy eggs, toast and bagels at the counter. We had no problem with crowds but I can imagine in the summer there would be a line backing up at the counter. Oh, yes - real plates and utensils - no foam plates or plastic forks! Decent sized fitness room with 2 treadmills, stairmaster and nice multi-station weight machine. There's also a game room, but some of the games weren't functioning properly (we were reimbursed). The elevators are really nice and super fast! This has got to be one of the very best values in Orlando, particularly if you like the suite idea. I would guess prices might rise now that the renovation is done. (www.mousesavers has special rate codes, although it's sometimes cheaper just using AAA.) The location is great for WDW, etc. - centrally located, close to Downtown Disney, too; about 12 minutes from Magic Kingdom. 5 minutes from Premium Outlets. If you can't book here, another hotel with suites that I like is Comfort Suites Maingate East - not separate rooms but one room with a small divider wall, sofa/coffee table and wet bar with microwave and refrig. The other nice suite hotel is Doubletree - near Downtown Disney, which has two BIG separate rooms (and free continental breakfast if you book through www.mousesavers.com). However, their rates have gone up - used to be about $99 last summer but more like $179 these days.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: 4angles
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a 7 night stay. Renovation of all the rooms was completed in mid-October and the rooms are wonderful. The beds are new, tall and comfortable with fluffy white duvets. It was like sleeping in a cloud! The bathroom and vanity area have nice marble features and are very contemporary. The separate living room has a stylish decor and includes a mini-fridge, microwave, and a 42" HD flat screen TV (another large HD flat screen is in the bedroom). The full breakfast buffet, with eggs made to order, is a nice (free!) way to start each day. The kids swam in the pool twice and it appeared clean both times. We used the free shuttle to 3 of the Disney parks and had no complaints - the buses are nice, on-time, and there are several departure and return options everyday for each of the parks. This rooms provide a lot of space for families to spread out, and it's a great value (we got our room for $88 a night using the AAA discount). All of the staff we encountered were very friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sedonababe
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days in August. Found a good deal w/airfare, so I decided to go with this hotel. Customer service was excellent, from the bellman Bill, to housekeeping. My room wasn't ready, so they gave me a discount at the restaurant for lunch. Didn't have a chance to take a dip in the pool, but the area was clean. The rooms are under renovation. New flat screen televisons, carpet, and painting. Unfortunately, I didn't get one of the new rooms, but the old one was fine. No noise problems. The shuttle to Disney is worth it. Comfortable clean buses.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough”
Reviews.Author: follybeach
Reviews.Content: The room, linens, and upholstery smelled of stale smoke. We spent one night here with our 2 year old and were happy to be leaving. There was a full breakfast which was not very good, but it was nice that it was available. The night staff was not very helpful, but the morning staff all were very nice. The sofa in the living area had a hole in it. All in all, the hotel was just not that great. We paid $100 for the stay, I'm glad it wasn't more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: janhappycamper
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently spent a week at this all-suite hotel. Our rooms were spacious, well-equipped, and immaculate. The bed was comfortable and the room was really quiet. The customer service (with the exception of the grumpy egg cook) was outstanding. One morning, we discovered our car had a dead battery and within minutes, a man came out with a battery charger and got us on our way to Epcot without missing a beat! A large, varied breakfast buffet is included in the room price. There were so many food choices that there would certainly be something for everyone's tastes! There is a delicious restaurant adjoining the lobby. It was beautifully decorated and peaceful after a hot, busy day at the Disney parks. The waitstaff was outstanding. The food was excellent and reasonably priced. All this for only $89 per night! We have found our new home-away-from-home for all our future trips to Disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: funmom2IL
Reviews.Content: The Buena Vista Suites is a great option if you don't want to pay the $$$ to stay at the Disney Resorts. The best price I found was on the hotel website. It's very close to all the parks, I used a rental car so can't speak to the shuttle bus service The room was very comfortable and exactly as advertised. We had two queen beds with the bathroom separating the bedroom and living room which included a small refrigerator, sink and microwave. The fold out sofa bed in the living room wasn't extremely comfortable but was servicable. The free breakfast buffet was the best by far that I've ever had at a hotel. There were an assortment of pastries, scrambled eggs, hash brown potatoes, hash, biscuits, sausage gravy and either bacon or ham. Also a kitchen making eggs to order, and there was an assortment of cereals and fruit. We would hit the breakfast early and grab a snack while in the Disney parks, great way to cut down on some of the costs of the trip. The only complaint we had was with the sound level of adjoining rooms' water. If the toilet was flushed or the shower was running the sound was very loud, but we never heard our neighbors talking or their television. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Produce
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 5 nights in March 2008. Great location, near all parks, restaurants, etc. Kids loved having their own room with a TV, fridge, sink, desk, etc. Free hot breakfast every day was really nice and conveinent. We didn't have to wait on a line for a table or food. Freindly staff helped us with everything we needed. Only negative is that the in room safe is extra. Should be included in the room price. Otherwise good place to stay while visiting Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Staff warm, rooms need work”
Reviews.Author: planned
Reviews.Content: Stayed this week for my husband's business conference. Bus provided free with long waits to the Convention Center. Internet $9.99 a day. Front desk staff very warm and friendly each time I passed by. Some people commented on its location as convenient but on a busy corner with much traffic. Lobby minimal (wifi there is $6.99) but current upholstery, etc. But as for the rooms, the furniture is in bad need of a remodel/ refresh, small older TVs, grout in bath needs a cleanup, and it is the basic formica world. Yes, there is a separate living room with a door that closes between living and bed room. Very average and would not recommend to friends...especially after my husband told me that the rate was $169.00!! His business travel agent is not looking for the best rate evidentally as I checked dates immediately after our visit and they were $129.00. Frankly I would give it a rate of the $89.00 at best.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Find”
Reviews.Author: FarAndWide_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a three day stay here in February. Weather was geat and so was the hotel. Big room, comfortable bed, nice full free breakfast, heated pool and jacuzzi, shuttle to Disney, etc. The staff was very helpful and there was plenty of parking. Like one other reviewer noted, the clothes dryers on the 4th floor was a bit slow and it took two tries to dry a load. It's sure nice to have four washers and dryers to choose from (2 on floor 1 and 2 on floor 4). The hotel has seen a lot of use, but they have a good maintenance policy as it does not have a worn appearance. There is a nice Irish restaurant down the street - Frankie Farrell's Irish Pub & Grille.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jswncrw
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here Dec. 19-22, 2007 with our small dog. It was very comfortable and most employees were very pleasant. I loved the fact of them accepting small pet. The free full breakfast buffet saved our family of 4 alot of money! The pool is very nice and HEATED with a very nice jacuzzi outside. Our 2 room suite had a jacuzzi tub in it. Our only complaint is of the water pressure of the shower and the dryers not working great in the laundry service room on the 4th floor. The first floor dryers work better. It took us 3 tries to get our clothes dry which they refunded back to us. It's $2.50 a load for laundry. But other than that, it was a very pleasant stay and they also have a nice tour bus to shuttle you back and forth to the Disney attractions! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: lawnhill
Reviews.Content: most helpful friendly staff, nothing was too much trouble. room clean, very comfortable, only minimul noise heard , breakfast basic, but as it is free, you could not complain. I would highly recommend this hotel to UK visitors as the location is superb, and the courtesty buses give an excellent coverage. I would also very highly recommend Michael Daley private cab hire, he is wonderful, reasonable, on time, and will take you anywhere, even has a trailor for additional luggage, or in my case would take my mobility scooter, at no extra charge. Supermarket, and Pondersora steak house opposite hotel, busy road, but we managed to cross easily. I will definatly stay there again, and thank all the staff for their consideration and kindess.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel...with perks”
Reviews.Author: Lizziesmom
Reviews.Content: The Buena Vista Suites is not a bad place to stay in Orlando. Their rates are reasonable for the area. They have a complimentary breakfast for their guests which they keep open for the early risers 7 am and for those of us who prefer to sleep in. They provide free transportation to the Disney Theme Parks through Mears Transportation Service. The rooms were clean (yet could use some updating) and the staff was very friendly. Be forewarned, however, the rooms lack soundproofing. Whenever a shower or sink was turned on or a toilet was flushed in the rooms above or next door, the noise came directly into my room. If someone sneezed in any of the adjoining rooms, the sneeze was heard. I would think some insulation could wisely have been used in all the walls.. If you can sleep through loud noises, you won't have any problem sleeping here. This hotel isn't fancy. It's ok for a family vacation and the transportation to Disney and the complimentary breakfast are definite perks.

Reviews.Title: “Value-Seekers will like- Luxury-Seekers will not.”
Reviews.Author: TennTraveler44
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for $89 a night through the Mousesavers.com website. I was taking my two daughters (age 7 and 10) on their first trip to Disney. Here are my thoughts; Pros; Two-room set-up with seperate TVs was nice for kids and parents. Mini-fridge and microwave very handy. Free breakfast buffet every morning. Laundry room has coin-operated washing machines and dryers. Well stocked gift shop. Arcade game room for kids. Very spacious and comfortable lobby. Nice pool and hot tub. Full time concierge service. Free shuttle service to Disney parks. Awesome room service food. Nice restaurant available for lunch and dinner. CVS drug store, Pizza take-out, Chinese buffet and Ponderosa restaurant located right across the street. Cons; It's hard to complain about a $89 deal in the overpriced land of Disney. If I were to complain, here are my thoughts; Sleeping in the sofa bed "room", the walls are paper thin. I could hear the opening and closing of every door in the vicinity. The crying kids next door with their yelling parents is not the best wake-up call. It was also very loud every time they flushed their toilet or used their sink. The free breakfast is worth what you pay for it. The bus service to Disney leaves at 9:00 am to some parks. With the parks opening at 9:00 am, you cannot get the jump on the crowds. Even though the hotel is a couple of miles from Disney property, our bus trip back from the park took over an hour, as we had to stop for pick-ups at each of the Disney parks. After a long, hot day, that return trip seems excrutiatingly long. The lobby has two computers with Internet access that can be used for $10 per hour (hint: use the monitor on the left-the monitor display on the right is broken). Crossing the road on foot to get to the drug store and restaurants across the street is VERY dangerous! My kids and I were nearly hit by a car that was weaving between lanes and FLYING. Concierge tried to talk me into attending a time share sales pitch at the Marriott. In summary, if you are looking for a cheap place to stay that is close to Disney, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay At”
Reviews.Author: PeterMarkham
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 spent 7 nights at this hotel in August & we all loved it. The hotel was well maintained inside & out. The suite was well-ventilated. The living room gives us a lot more space than what we usually get from a standard hotel room, plus the large sofa bed & extra TV were huge bonuses for our 2 boys who don't like sharing beds or TVs. My husband has a bad back so he is picky about mattresses but he found the beds & pillows there very comfortable. The shower had good pressure & lots of hot water. We got lots of thick fluffy towels. The only minor inconvenience was that the fridge did not have a freezer section to make ice. The buffet breakfast was impressive especially since it was free. There were scrambled, over easy, or sunny side up eggs, sausages, french toast, pancakes, different styles of potatoes, ham, croissants, assorted cereals, yogurts, fruits, juice, milk, hot chocolate... The exercise room had a good variety of equipments with plenty of towels & a TV. The pool was a bit small but the water was nice & warm & there were plenty of towels & lounge chairs. We got free newspapers every morning Mon-Fri. We got a very good rate from the hotel's website & found the hotel every bit as nice as what the website claims. It was definitely great value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “O.K.”
Reviews.Author: mmd13233
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Buena Vista Suites a few weeks ago. Pros: Free breakfast was very good and a great deal for a family of four. They had toast, bagels, eggs, made to order eggs, some potato option each day, some sort of meat option each day, pancakes or waffles each day, 4 kinds of cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, muffins or danishes, any kind of tea or coffee you might like, hot chocolate, skim milk, chocolate milk, etc. You can definitely find something to eat there! I liked having the children on the pull out couch so we could watch TV in the Master Bedroom once they had gone to bed. Cons: Other reviews are accurate about the paper thin walls. You hear every shower, not just the ones above and around you. You hear every toliet flush. It's super loud and if you are a light sleeper, you will have difficulty sleeping. I did. Also, the pool was dirty. Not just bugs and leaves. It had black slime on the edge of the tile where the water level is. Also it didn't smell as if the water was properly chlorinated. Asked the front desk because I was worried about the water safety (I have two small children) and was told pool is maintained daily but they'd send out someone to check. Maintenance guy did come out sometime later. He didn't dip the pool, check the water or anything. He just picked up wet towels and put them away. I wouldn't stay here again because I am a light sleeper and the pool is a big thing for us with small kids and the neglect of the pool was not good. If you are a heavy sleeper, need some extra space and want a free breakfast, this may be your place.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: akana
Reviews.Content: I hated it. The rooms..aka suites.. echoed everytime we talked.It was like being in a box. The beds , very uncomfortable. The sheets did not fit the beds. All night they kept slipping off and I was getting grossed out because I did not want to end up on the mattress. The bathroom was very small with rust stains. The only possibly good thing is the lobby itself. Deceiving for the rest of the hotel. Very nice clean lots of action. And the free buffet breakfast was good , if you can find a seat. They need more seating. The shuttle to Disneyworld had odd times to leave.After 1130am , you were on your own there. which was fine with me as we drove and parked on our own. Come and go when we wanted. Since there is alot more hotels to choose from , I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Buena Vista Suites OK”
Reviews.Author: cindyr222
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buena Vista Suites on June 15 th on our way to Disney World proper. We liked the size of the rooms and the fact that the all suites hotel offers nice sized rooms to larger families and privacy to adults . Let me give you a run down on the pros and cons. Pros: Great customer service. THey called us a week prior and asked if we needed golf reservations, tickets , etc, and confirmed our reservation. THey also sent an email a few days prior to reconfirm. Check in went smoothly. Breakfast was good in our eyes. Can't understand the complaints about the food. It's free folks. Come on! THere were eggs made to order, sausage, fruit , cereal, yogurt, breads, danishes, etc, juice, coffee, etc, all fine food. Got a letter when we returned thanking us for our stay. Nice touch customer service. People will remember this. Never in my 46 years has a hotel contacted us so much to see if we needed anything or to remind us of an upcoming visit. Rooms were clean, beds were on the soft side but we slept well. No outside noise except the loud toilets flushing. Very close to Disney world maingate. WE stayed on the road the hotel is on and within 3-4 mins , we were on Disney property. Very convenient. THey also have a free shuttle for folks not wanting to pay the $10 parking fee. Not sure of the times. All I do know is they share the shuttle with Caribe Royale and there are at least 3 going and 3 return times for the shuttle. Cons: THe hotels pool and hottub were dirty with dead bugs and leavesin the pool and hot tub when we went out to swim at 6:30 pm. Maybe the pool boy already left for the day? Again, loud toilet, and rooms were a little worn and tatered. Our non smoking room smelled of stale smoke. Since we had an ok from the desk before we even booked the room, to use the Caribe Royale pool ( Next door sister resort to Buena Vista) we decided to walk arcross the parking lot to the Caribe Royale. Boy were we glad we did. Absolutely beautiful pool. Waterfall, slide, nice , huge pool. THe kids really enjoyed their time there. Nicest pool I have ever swam in. THe photos don't do it justice. Advice, watch your little ones coming off the slide. The current from the waterslide is strong and pulls them away from the edge of the pool. Had to grab an arm of a little one and bring her to safety because the parents were in their sun chairs while their child was in the pool alone. BIG NO NO FOLKS!!!!!!!!!!!Tips: My advice , stay at Buena Vista Suites for the free breakfast, use Caribe Royale's pool and book on Mousesavers.com, much cheaper rate than the hotel site. WE even saw Caribe Royale folks walking over to the Buena Vista for the free breakfast as they don't offer a free one. Hope this helps someone. Have fun in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Lambert B
Reviews.Content: Excellent location central to all the Orlando attractions. Great value for accomodation. Older suite type of hotel with all amenities. Room decor a bit dated from the eighties but clean and serviceable. Fridge available in room. I had the two queen beds separated by door from the pull out sofa living room. Two TVs, one bathroom to share. Internet wire available, 6.99 per day (reg speed) 9.99 for higher speed, regular worked fine. Small gym with good equipment, new and well maintained. Parking free and shuttle to attractions. Breakfast buffet, very busy but lots of food..even some healthy cereals and fruit, as well as choice of eggs, bacon etc included in room rate. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: dharma2972
Reviews.Content: This is our 5 visit within the last 2 years. The front desk and management staff are very helpful and prompt. Thank you Arianna and Melissa for another wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want a hotel whose staff cares”
Reviews.Author: ParentOfTwo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before in February 2005, and we loved it. This experience was the exact opposite. The hotel has either changed since I last visited or March/April is not the time to stay here. It was dominated by field trips. I like high school kids, and I was on many high school trips. That said, they don't create a very family friendly environment, even when they're on their best behavior. Additionally, we had a very bad event occur while at the hotel. While I won't go into the details, I will say that bad things happen at hotels all the time. It's not what happens, but how management responds that matters. The management was condescending (supervisors were great, but the head manager was horrific), uncaring, uncommunative, and downright rude. It's clear that our business and our experience was unimportant to the manager, and as a result, I would never stay in this hotel again. About the hotel itself: It's very close to disney, it has two separate rooms (which amounts to an 8x8 living room w/o a window which has a door separating it from the bedroom/bathroom), which is why we've stayed in the past. The hotel has two years of additional wear, with no updates. There were some pretty major issues with the room that were just cobbled together, and the hotel is in major need of an update. It's fairly dirty in general at this point, mostly due to aging. The quality of the breakfast buffet has gone way downhill. The fruit on the buffet bar is canned; the eggs are undercooked and runny, and all of the heated pastries (waffles, pancakes) are pre-packaged and often cold, hard, and inedible. The only saving grace is the over easy eggs that are cooked when requested. Regardless, it was nice to leave for each day with a full stomach. The kitchenette has a microwave and fridge and adequate storage space for groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hawaii046
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buena Vista and thought the value was great for our money.We had four teenagers and two adults-the suite provided us with two rooms which was awesome and a small refrigerater-there is a Ponderossa steak house across the street which is great for a family as well.There is also shuttle service to the theme parks from the hotel as well.The pool is small but Buena Vistas sister hotel is right next door so my kids swam in their pool-no questions asked.I would stay here again.Rooms are dated but who cares-we just need a place to crash after doing the theme parks all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect place for us”
Reviews.Author: 32CATS
