Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LBV Suites for 3 nights at the beginning of Dec 06 and we hope to get back there real soon. Very close to everything and easy to get to. Very relaxing and quiet and the jacuzzi tub is heavenly. Also very handy to have a safe in the closet. The kitchen has everything you could ever want and the bedrooms are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Calvertgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June/2006 and again December 2006, my family loves it here. They are so nice and very pleasant. The rooms are very clean and reasonable. It is so close to the parks and they have a shuttle if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price! Great Place”
Reviews.Author: purplepanda19438
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 13-20 2006 with hubby and 3 kids. accomodations were clean and very spacious. 2 Q beds in bedroom plus plenty of room for a crib for our youngest. plenty of drawer space and a large amoire for all our belongings. Bathroom has tub/shower combo and toilet. vanity area is outside. great for mornings with 5 people. living area has pull out sofa (not used) and an arm chair and coffee table, a mini fridge, microwave, bar sink and decent counter area and round table with 2 stools. Full door separates living area from bedroom/bath area. this was great at night as kids were exhausted and would go to bed, while hubby and I could watch a little tv and unwind. Maid service was great. Room was always clean and plenty of towels left. One day came back to hotel around 12:30 for naps and room was not made up yet. Put up do not disturb sign and when we left the room at 3:30 there was a note saying maid had been there and if we needed clean towels etc to contact the front desk. The maid cart was not on our floor at that time. I expected no cleaning that day. However I had forgotten something and came back to the room about 15 min later to find the maid had returned and was cleaning our room. Staff was extremely friendly. Breakfast was adequate and beats paying for a meal outside the hotel! Kids mostly at from cereal bar. hubby and I had the eggs cooked to order. arrive to breakfast early- it gets crowded by 9. pool was just a pool but being at WDW most of the time, we only used it 3x for about an hour and that was sufficient for the kids. It's extremely close to WDW- AK being the closest to the hotel and very easy access coming and going. daughter clogged the toilet with too much tp 2x (how embarrassing!) called maintenance and they came both times within 5 min to fix problem. got internet rate of $89 per night. would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky rooms and they try to bill for broken pictures”
Reviews.Author: billmd
Reviews.Content: When we went into our room it smelled like someone had been smoking but it turned out to be the cleaner they use. Room condition was run down and very drab. They charge $7 day for internet where other hotels include it in price. After we got home from our stay I saw they charged me $70 more than my checkout invoice. When I called them they said we were charged for a broken picture, which of course we didn't. I suspect this is how they redecorate their rooms because when I called accounting to find out what the charge was for they gave me a bunch of spin about "incidentals". I finanlly got fed up and told them I wanted to know what I was being billed extra for. Thats when I was told I was being billed for a picture. Their "information" desk wasn't very helpful as all they wanted to do was push us to a "free breakfast" at a neighboring hotel where we could get discounted Disney tickets. They failed to mention that you have to sit through a real estate sales seminar for 90 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: drentb
Reviews.Content: We thought it was an excellent value, at 50% or more below comparable properties. It is hard to understand what some of the other reviewers were complaining about. We found the unit to be quiet, clean, and convenient. The breakfast buffet was good (not as luxurious as, say, the Marriott, but then not $15 either). It would be a real value for a family of four, with four breakfasts. A bit crowded, maybe, but far less crowded than a regular hotel room for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “It will do”
Reviews.Author: esmomrn
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy hotel but for the small amount of time we spent in the room it was fine. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The pool is small but we weren't there to swim. The rooms are clean but there are some minor cosmetic repairs that they could make.The rooms are small. We had 2 adults and 2 children and there was enough room. If you have more than 4 people it might be a little crowded. The shuttle service was good most of the time. Once we had to wait 15 minutes for the shuttle to return us to the hotel. Not many others things to do in the immediate area. Small shopping center across the street. It has a 7 eleven , cvs, ponderosa, a chinese resturant and a pizza place. They have a safe in the room but you have to pay for the lock. Having the exact same thing every morning got a little old. They rarely had fresh fruit, it was mainly canned fruit. But the rest of the food is ok. I complained to hotel manager about the cook not changing his gloves appropriately and she sort of defended him and did not follow up with me. Not sure what to make of that.

Reviews.Title: “buena vista suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was very clean and I was comfortable with the room except the shower had NO pressure at all making it difficult to shower . The only other gripe i had was that every time we'd ask the guest services a simple question, they wouldnt simply answer our question but they would try to sell us something, very frustrating . Shuttle was OK, late only once, coulda have had more flexible shuttle schedules.

Reviews.Title: “Buena Vista not-so-sweet!”
Reviews.Author: ctmb-traveller
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 days there with my 9 year old son in April 2006 after booking the hotel on Hotwire. The first room I was given reeked of smoke, which the maid offered to cure with a spray can. The second room was much better. The suites are large enough, with a high ceiling, but the living room area feels dark and uninviting and has a pronounced echo. The room has 2 small TVs. Bedding is cheap. The rest of the hotel is OK, with a small pool that strangely has lights only in one end. The breakfast (included) was about the worst I've had in my many hotel stays. I didn't know eggs could be so bad! My son even found the oatmeal inedible. Fortunately there was cereal. The location was fine, with nearby stores and easy access to theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel for Disney visitors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location and the fact that our two children could sleep in the living area (without us!). We were not disappointed; we reached the entrance to Disney World in 3 minutes. The rooms were simple but clean, and the staff friendly and helpful. There is nothing posh about the accomodations, but it was a perfect place to crash after spending long days at the parks. It was comparable to the Disney hotel we stayed in two years ago, but cheaper and roomier. The free breakfast buffet was icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “Just Average - better hotels in the area”
Reviews.Author: jawdmb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a week with my family while attending a business conference at the Gaylord Palms. The Gaylord was sold out, as well as most other hotels in the area so we got stuck at the Buena Vista. The hotel is just average. The rooms are worn and outdated, the free breakfast every morning was horrible, but with 5 people we opted for it instead of driving somewhere with a 6 month old in the heat. The outlet mall is really close though, that was a nice break! The Caribe Royal, it's sister property, is a magnificent property and right next door - I've stayed there before and was impressed! The Buena Vista needs a facelift. The linens and furnshings are very worn and need improvements. We called for a crib (turned out to be a playpen) and it came immediately. The bathroom is a decent size and the extra sinks were a big plus. We were in an end room which gave us a bit more space - rooms sizes are excellent. Staff was ok, but not overly attentive. There was laundry on the first floor which was great to use instead of dry cleaning. If the hotel polished itself up and put some money into new furnishings and updates, it would be an okay place to stay. There are many other hotels in the area that I would recommend before the Buena Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: FrugalVoyager
Reviews.Content: The facility was good to above average, but the staff really makes this hotel shine. Parking, check-in, pool, etc. was easy and convenient. Drugstore and restaurants right accross the street. This hotel allows pets (we didn't have one) but you wouldn't know it because the suite rooms were so clean and quite. (I would recommend a room on the back side of the hotel however, since I did hear some traffic noise). I totally disagree with the unfavorable reviews on this site and would definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “So So.........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a rainy 3 day stay in Orlando. This hotel does have a nice lobby and the staff is friendly but it's pretty obvious that this is a very old hotel that must have changed hands a million times. It's just run down from all of the traffic. We stayed on the third floor, which was very qiuet and the room did not have any odors. The refigerator was falling out of the cabinet but the little microwave and sink was nice to have. The phone lines went out from a lightning strike while we were there and the staff did not let us know about it, which could have been a disaster if we didn't bring our own alarm clock. They could have slipped a note under the door about the phone lines, that's not asking too much. Didn't use the pool since it was raining, but it looks nice. The complimentary breakfast was just "average". They have canned fruit, instead of fresh and it is pretty much the same everyday. The silverware was all bent up and the cups were all styrofoam. Be careful of the shuttle to the parks.They stop at the property next door but blew us off twice. Be aggrressive with the staff if that happens, they can phone the bus company to send another one. Also, be careful about where to catch the "return" bus because they make you wait in the middle of the park's parking lot on lanes 9-10. The Disney resort buses definetely seem to be more efficient.I wouldn't stay here again to visit Disney, but maybe just a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “orlando in fall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had to stay an extra few days at the Buena Vista Suites because of Hurricane Wilma. I thought it was a very clean and nice hotel for the price and the free breakfast buffet was good also. Its about the same everyday other then changing the meat. The only problem we had was with the gate that opened to the pool area was not working correctly for a few days so we had to enter through the restaurant area which did not make the gentleman very happy.it was less then 10 min from the Disney area which was great! I would reccomend for a family.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here”
Reviews.Author: Lisa-OH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to the close proximity of Disney. The price was only $88 a night and included that wonderful breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpful. Every time we came back from the parks the front desk staff asked how it was, and how we were doing. Our answer was always, great and exhausted. If you have to do laundry, this is not the best place. There was something wrong with the timer on a dryer on the 4th floor. Timer ran down quicker than it should have. Otherwise, we had a great time. If you are looking for a place to bunk for the night, shower and breakfast in the morning, this is it. Comfortable rooms, friendly staff, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the rates were very good, we wanted a suite, and the location is fabulous. We were two Boomers celebrating a 25th anniversary without the kids. Everything about the room was great-furniture was very nice, the housekeeping service was A-1, and it was very quiet. There is lots of storage space. All the appliances worked fine. We had a jacuzzi tub and that was great after tromping around Disney all day. The breakfast was just fine. It was hot, and there was plenty of it. I enjoyed the eggs cooked to order. This service is free and it saves time! Avoiding a restaurant first thing in the morning is truly added value. Variety was good. As far as location, it was a smooth and easy drive to Disney and SeaWorld. Parking at this hotel was easy. It is close to the Crossroads shopping Center which has a grocery store. The staff on the desk were friendly and fun. We had absolutely no problems at this all-suite hotel, and will stay there again if we ever get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “A Pretty Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: kapjdp
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for one week, and we were a little concerned prior to arrival becuse of some of the poor reviews posted here. As it turned out, we thought the hotel was pretty great. A real value with decent accomodations and very good customer service. We had a nice suite with 2 very comfortable pillow-top mattresses on the queen sized beds. There were 2 TVs in the suite, and a full sized door between the sitting area and bedroom/bath area. This was great because we could put our 8-year old to bed, and she wasn't disturbed by lights or TV coming from the sitting room. The suite was always cleaned promptly in the morning with plenty of fresh thick towels. The breakfast was decent, scrambled eggs, donuts, juice, milk, cereal and fried eggs made to order. The breakfast area was kept clean and stocked. Also, the front desk and concierge staff were very friendly, quick to respond and gave us some great coupons for the Hard Rock and several other Downtown Disney restaurants. The pool is not spectacular. It is pretty basic with a small in-ground hot-tub. Go to Typhoon Lagoon instead! All-in-all, the hotel was a great value, clean and with really quick and easy access to Disney, with barely any traffic! One more thing...they do allow dogs here, and 2 times we saw dogs in the lobby during the week. We do not like to see animals inside a hotel!! But still, we thought this was a decent hotel, and we would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Buena Vista Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 8203 World Center Drive, Orlando, FL 32821
